title: Full Time - Facebook Community Manager (Patient Support Group)
description:
Role Type: Full-time (Remote)

Platform: Private
 Group (Verified Patients Only)



About the Role:

We’re looking for a 
munity Manager to own and grow our private patient community. This group exists to educate, support, and retain patients using GLP-1 medications—while reducing anxiety, confusion, and unnecessary support tickets.

This is not a passive moderator role. You’ll actively drive engagement, education, and trust.



Core Responsibilities:

- Community Engagement & Moderation

- Welcome new members and set expectations for group behavior

- Moderate discussions to ensure medical safety, positivity, and accuracy

- De-escalate concerns, confusion, or misinformation before it becomes support tickets or refunds

- Enforce community rules and remove spam or unsafe advice

- Education & Content

- Post clear, easy-to-understand tutorials on:

- How to read dosing instructions

- How to inject medication safely

- Managing side effects

- Storage, timing, and expectations

- Create pinned guides, FAQs, and resource folders

- Translate medical concepts into patient-friendly language (without giving medical advice)

- Engagement & Events

- Create recurring engagement formats:

- Weekly check-ins



Progress/accountability threads:

- “Ask the Nurse” or educational Q&A-style posts

- Plan and host live or scheduled events (text-based or video)

- Run challenges, giveaways, and milestone celebrations



Updates & Communication:

- Post shipment updates, promo announcements, and service notices in a calm, reassuring tone

- Coordinate with support and ops teams so messaging is accurate and timely

- Reduce “panic posts” by proactively communicating delays or changes



Ideal Background & Skills

Required:

1. Hours are from 8pm to 5am MLA time (Manila Time)

2. Strong written communication skills (clear, calm, reassuring)

3. Experience managing
 Groups or online communities

4. Comfortable handling sensitive health-related conversations

5. Highly organized and proactive



Strongly Preferred:

- Nursing, medical assistant, healthcare, or telehealth background

- Familiarity with GLP-1 medications (Semaglutide, Tirzepatide)

- Experience in patient education, health coaching, or clinical support



Big Plus:

- Has personally managed or participated in a health/weight-loss community

- Understands patient psychology, anxiety, and trust-building

- Can balance empathy with firm boundaries (no medical advice)



What Success Looks Like:

- High engagement with helpful, calm conversations

- Fewer repetitive questions and fewer support escalations

- Members helping members (accountability, encouragement)

- Patients feel supported, informed, and confident in treatment

- The group becomes a retention and trust asset—not a complaint board



What This Role Is Not:

- Not just deleting posts

- Not customer support tickets

- Not medical diagnosis or prescribing

- Not influencer-style content creation



Compensation: Competitive hourly or monthly rate (based on experience)



If you have read this full application please add the word "snuffy" as the first line in your application and answer the 4 questions above.

title: Medical Virtual Assistant / Call Representative – Therapy Practice
description:
Company Overview:

• We are a growing in-home therapy practice providing physical, occupational, and speech therapy services to patients in need. Our mission is to make therapy accessible, timely, and efficient while providing excellent patient care. Our virtual team is an integral part of supporting our therapists and ensuring patients have a seamless experience.



Position Summary:

• We are seeking a detail-oriented and professional Medical Virtual Assistant / Call Representative to support our therapists with scheduling, patient follow-ups, calendar management, and communication. This role involves managing calls, routing patients appropriately, sending appointment reminders, and keeping both the therapist and patients organized and informed.



Key Responsibilities:

• Answer incoming patient calls and route them to the appropriate therapist or department

• Schedule, reschedule, and cancel appointments, ensuring accuracy in the calendar

• Follow up with patients regarding upcoming appointments, no-shows, or changes in schedule

• Maintain and update the therapist’s calendar in real time

• Send
 and SMS reminders for appointments, consents, or therapy updates

• Manage patient communications professionally and empathetically via phone,
, or messaging apps

• Track and resolve scheduling conflicts or patient inquiries proactively

• Maintain accurate patient records and documentation in scheduling or EHR platforms

• Escalate urgent patient concerns to the therapist when necessary



Qualifications:

• Previous experience in medical virtual assistance, call center, or healthcare coordination preferred

• Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple patients, schedules, and tasks simultaneously

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, professional and empathetic demeanor

• Comfortable using multiple digital platforms (Google Calendar,
, EHR/scheduling software)

• Ability to remain calm and problem-solve under pressure

• Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

• Familiarity with HIPAA or patient confidentiality guidelines is a plus

• Availability to work U.S. time zones or overlapping hours with therapist schedules



Work Schedule:

• Full-time or part-time with flexible hours to cover therapy appointments

• Remote position



Why Join Us:

• Make a direct impact on patients’ health and wellness

• Be part of a collaborative and supportive virtual team

• Opportunities to grow within a patient-focused healthcare practice



How to apply:

title: Finance Specialist
description:
Overview:

We, at STR Cribs, are seeking a highly organized and proactive Finance Specialist to manage a variety of recurring tasks and assist with one-off projects in a fast-paced work environment. The ideal candidate will handle daily, weekly, and monthly finance and operations-related responsibilities, ensuring smooth financial operations and supporting the team in various administrative tasks. This role requires excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple priorities efficiently.



Responsibilities:



Financial Operations & Billing

Assist the Finance Manager with day-to-day financial activities

Review and process payment requests, including running automated approval or rejection workflows

Support billing activities, including deposits, progress billings, final payments, and change order deposits

Review and bill for change order deposits as needed

Monitor accounts receivable (A/R) and perform follow-ups as required

Extract and prepare daily A/R aging reports



Project & System Setup

Set up new projects with accurate data entry

Ensure proper integration and data flow between CRM systems and the accounting system

Prepare daily payment and new project status reports for leadership



Vendor & Payment Management

Onboard vendors through Buildertrend and payment platforms as required

Review credit card transactions and ensure proper allocation to the correct QuickBooks categories



Communication & Administrative Support

Monitor and manage incoming
s and Slack messages, responding to inquiries and requests in a timely and professional manner

Handle finance-related calls with vendors and internal stakeholders as needed



Compliance & Process Support

Support finance-related compliance activities, including adherence to internal policies and regulatory requirements

Assist with documentation, recordkeeping, and coordination of required filings





Requirements:

Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.

Strong spreadsheets and data management skills; experience with ERP or construction project management software highly preferred.

Comfortable handling calls related to finance, vendors, and internal coordination in a professional and timely manner.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

Attention to detail and accuracy in processing financial data and managing tasks.

Ability to work independently and take initiative on both recurring and one-off tasks.

Familiarity with finance tools such as Buildertrend, Slack, and automated workflows.

Experience in project management and financial operations is preferred

Willing to work on night shift - EST





Compensation & Benefits

Competitive salary based on experience

Paid time off and holidays

Professional growth and career advancement opportunities



Company: STR Cribs



Please send your CV, assessment (link below) and a 5-7mins Loom video explaining your assessment answer to 
 as well as answer the Google form linked here: 



Assessment Link:

title: Social Media Strategist & Manager (Organic) | Contractor
description:
Platforms: Google My Business, AgoraPulse, Instagram,
, LinkedIn, YouTube, TikTok, Reddit, X

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Type: Full-time hours (Contractor)

Working Hours: 9:00am to 5:00pm EST

Clients: North America



About the Role

We’re looking for a Social Media Strategist & Manager (Organic) to support North American brands through consistent, on-brand organic content execution and community engagement. You’ll manage content calendars, posting, and performance tracking across multiple platforms, with a strong focus on brand voice, responsiveness, and measurable growth.



This is a contractor role with full-time hours and set working hours of 9:00am to 5:00pm EST. You will work closely with our internal account team and collaborate with our Paid Media Specialist to ensure continuity across organic and paid messaging. You will not be responsible for managing paid ads.



Key Responsibilities

• Develop and execute organic social media strategies aligned with client goals and brand positioning

• Build and manage monthly content calendars (planning, approvals, scheduling, and execution)

• Write and adapt captions based on brand voice, audience, and platform best practices

• Manage and optimize Google My Business listings (posts, updates, reviews, and insights)

• Schedule, publish, and monitor content using AgoraPulse

• Manage day-to-day posting and community engagement on Instagram,
, LinkedIn, and other social platforms

• Monitor comments, messages, and reviews; respond promptly in a brand-appropriate tone

• Identify and escalate sensitive issues, complaints, or reputation risks to the account team quickly

• Ensure content is consistent with brand guidelines, messaging, and voice across all channels

• Track performance and deliver monthly reporting with clear insights and recommendations

• Recommend improvements to strengthen content performance, engagement, and platform growth

• Provide ongoing strategic direction to support organic social success (content mix, creative direction, channel priorities)

• Collaborate with our Paid Media Specialist to ensure continuity and synergy across organic and paid efforts

• Work closely with internal team members (design, copy, account team) to maintain quality and meet deadlines

• Support presentations, pitches, and proposals by contributing organic social strategy and recommendations

• Stay current on platform trends, algorithm updates, and best practices



Qualifications

• 2–4 years experience managing organic social media for brands or agencies

• Hands-on experience with AgoraPulse (or similar tools like Hootsuite/Sprout)

• Strong understanding of Google My Business optimization

• Excellent written English communication skills

• Experience supporting North American clients

• Highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented

• Reliable internet, professional workstation setup, and availability to work 9:00am to 5:00pm EST

• Must be consistently available during 9:00am to 5:00pm EST for internal communication, collaboration, and timely responses



Nice to Have

• Experience with multi-location businesses

• Experience supporting regulated or service-based industries

• Basic understanding of paid social strategy (collaboration only, not execution)

title: Local & On-Page SEO Specialist
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Contract: 6 months (with potential long-term opportunity)

Working Style: Independent, flexible hours, results-focused



> About Us



We’re The Riviera Group, a London-based cleaning company specialising in luxury home

window cleaning and professional gutter clearing. We pride ourselves on delivering top-quality,

reliable services with great customer care. Our goal is to make every customer feel like part of

our family, and we’re now looking to grow our online presence so more people can find us and

experience the quality we provide.



> Role Overview



We’re looking for an experienced Local SEO & On-page SEO Specialist who can take full

ownership of our website SEO and GMB profile. You’ll manage everything from on-page SEO

and website updates to citations, backlinks, and growing our local visibility.



This is a results-focused role — we expect you to plan, execute, track progress, and report

monthly. You’ll also build a 6-month plan to increase our website visibility, local rankings, and

organic leads.



If you’re successful at the end of the 6-month contract, there will be an opportunity to stay on

the team long-term to continue managing our SEO. The price for the ongoing role will be

negotiated with the successful candidate to ensure a salary that works for both parties.



> Key Responsibilities



Website & On-Page SEO

- Audit and optimise website pages for local and on-page SEO

- Write and publish new SEO-focused pages as needed

- Improve site structure, internal linking, metadata, and content

- Implement SEO best practices to increase organic traffic and rankings



Local SEO & Backlinks

- Build and manage local citations

- Create and manage high-quality backlinks

- Ensure NAP consistency across all platforms

- Identify opportunities to improve local search visibility



Google My Business Management

- Fully manage and optimise our Google My Business profile

- Improve local map pack rankings

- Manage posts, categories, services, images, and updates

- Support growth in reviews and engagement



Strategy & Reporting

- Build a clear 6-month SEO and GMB growth plan

- Track rankings, traffic, and lead performance

- Provide a monthly update/report covering progress, results, and next steps



> Requirements



- Proven experience in Local SEO and Google My Business management

- Strong knowledge of on-page SEO, content creation, citations, and backlinks

- Ability to work independently and take full ownership of SEO results

- Experience working with UK-based service businesses (preferred)

- Strong communication skills and ability to explain SEO strategy clearly



> To apply, please send the following to 



Subject Line: Local & On-Page SEO Specialist - [Full Name]



- Examples or a portfolio of previous SEO and GMB work

- Proof of results achieved for past clients (rankings, traffic, leads, etc.)

- 1-minute video explaining why you believe you’re a good fit for this role

- 1 thing you would do to improve our website (
)

- Confirmation if you have worked with UK-based service businesses before



Applications without proof of experience will not be considered. We will only accept applications sent to the company
 stated above.

title: HVAC/Plumbing CSR Dispatcher
description:
Title:  Service Dispatcher FLSA Status:  Non-Exempt Shift: 1st

Reports to:   Department:  Service Employment Status: Full-Time

Supervisory Responsibilities:  N/A Date Created/Last Evaluated: December 2024 

Summary 

This position requires a detail-oriented and organized individual to handle a variety of administrative tasks, including scheduling service calls, processing invoices, and managing customer correspondence. The role involves utilizing scheduling software, generating estimates, and ensuring timely completion of administrative tasks. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

Qualification Requirements

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

Minimum Qualifications

• High School Diploma or GED

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

• The ability to prioritize tasks, manage time effectively, and multitask.

• Strong verbal and written communication skills are necessary for interacting with customers, technicians, and other tea
mbers.

• Proficiency in computer software, including Microsoft Office Suite and dispatch software.

• The ability to accurately input data, track service calls, and process paperwork is crucial.

• The ability to identify and resolve issues in a timely and efficient manner.

• A positive and professional attitude, providing excellent customer service.

Supervisory Responsibilities

May have some supervisory responsibilities as the business grows

Essential Functions

• Answer incoming calls and
s promptly and professionally.

• Schedule and dispatch service calls to technicians.

• Follow up on open estimates and service calls to ensure customer satisfaction.

• Process and approve invoices and expense reports.

• Maintain accurate records of service calls, quotes, and invoices.

• Prepare and submit warranty claims.

• Generate and submit invoices for completed services.

• Track and manage accounts receivable.

• Assist technicians with technical questions and troubleshooting.

• Create estimates for recommended repairs and replacements.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand, bend, stretch, and walk. Vision requirements include reading a computer monitor, peripheral vision, and the ability to look from screen to objects on desk to visitors walking in the door. Color vision needed. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. 

Work Environment

Work is frequently performed inside a temperature-controlled office building. Level of noise varies in this fast-paced, busy work environment.

Travel

Some local travel may be required 

Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of the position.  All employees may have other duties assigned at any time

title: Amazon Specialist - Part Time
description:
Join Our Team as a Part-Time Amazon Specialist 



Job Type: Part-Time | Hours: During CST



Are you an Amazon wizard who loves optimizing listings, driving sales, and mastering marketplaces? We’re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented Amazon Specialist to take our store to the next level. This is a part-time, remote role perfect for someone who thrives on results and wants to grow with a dynamic company.



What You’ll Do:



- Manage and optimize our Amazon seller account (FBA/FBM) – listings, pricing, inventory, and more to increase sales

- Craft SEO-friendly titles, descriptions, and keywords to boost product visibility.

- Monitor account health, metrics, and customer feedback.

- Conduct market research and competitor analysis to spot opportunities.

- Run Amazon advertising campaigns (PPC, Sponsored Products) and analyze results.

- Collaborate with the team to ensure smooth fulfillment and operations.



What We’re Looking For:



- Proven experience managing Amazon seller accounts.

- Solid understanding of listing optimization, SEO, and Amazon PPC campaigns.

- Familiarity with Amazon Seller Central tools and policies.

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to work independently.

- Comfortable with Excel/Google Sheets and inventory management tools.

- Proactive, problem-solver, and adaptable to changing priorities.

- Reliable internet connection and a functional home office setup.

- Strong English communication skills.



Qualifications:



- Experience with multiple Amazon marketplaces (US, Canada, UK, etc.).

- Knowledge of Amazon advertising campaigns and analytics tools.

- Previous e-commerce experience.

- Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field.



How to Apply:

Send us:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short video introduction (max 2 minutes) starting with:

    "Hi, I’m your awesome Amazon Specialist!”

3. A portfolio outlining your relevant experience, including:

    - Examples of your previous work

    - Any relevant certifications or trainings



Important: Applications missing any of the above will not be considered. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Video Editor / Motion Graphics Designer
description:
We're seeking a skilled Video Editor, Motion Graphics Designer, and Content Creator to develop and produce educational content showcasing our trading indicators across YouTube, TikTok, and Instagram. This role combines content ideation, scriptwriting, screen recording, and video editing. This is a remote, part-time position (15-20 hours/week) with long-term growth potential.



Responsibilities

Content Creation & Strategy:



Develop content ideas and concepts for educational trading videos

Write scripts for short-form and long-form content

Plan content calendar aligned with product launches and features

Research trending topics in trading education space

Identify opportunities to showcase indicator features



Production:



Record screen footage from TradingView platform

Capture chart analysis and indicator demonstrations

Generate voiceovers using ElevenLabs AI voice tool

Gather all necessary assets for each video project



Editing & Post-Production:



Edit 8-12 short-form videos per week (YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, TikTok)

Produce 2-3 long-form YouTube tutorials per month (5-15 minutes)

Create motion graphics highlighting chart patterns and indicator signals

Add text overlays, annotations, and visual effects to trading charts

Maintain fast-paced editing style with 2-4 second cut intervals

Design thumbnails for YouTube content

Ensure all content meets financial compliance standards

Deliver videos within 24-48 hour turnaround time



General:



Manage entire video production workflow from concept to delivery

Maintain organized file structure and project archives

Collaborate on content strategy and brand development

Stay current on platform algorithms and best practices





Required Qualifications

Technical Skills:



Expert proficiency in Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

Strong motion graphics skills (After Effects preferred)

Experience with screen recording software (OBS, Camtasia, or similar)

Knowledge of TradingView platform or ability to learn quickly

Audio editing capabilities (syncing, mixing, mastering)

Experience with AI voiceover tools (ElevenLabs experience is a plus)

Understanding of vertical video formats and platform-specific requirements



Creative Skills:



Proven ability to generate engaging content ideas

Strong scriptwriting skills for educational content

Portfolio demonstrating fast-paced educational or explainer content

Experience creating content from concept to completion

Ability to explain complex topics simply and clearly



Operational:



Self-motivated and able to work independently

Excellent organizational and project management skills

Reliable high-speed internet for large file transfers

Consistent availability of 15-20 hours per week

Professional communication skills

Proactive problem-solving approach





Preferred Qualifications



Experience with financial, trading, or cryptocurrency content

Knowledge of ICT or Smart Money Concepts

Basic understanding of trading terminology and chart analysis

Previous work with compliance-sensitive content

Thumbnail design capabilities

Experience managing social media content calendars

Familiarity with YouTube SEO and analytics

Experience with AI voice generation tools





Content Style Requirements

Our videos require a specific editing approach:



Fast-paced cuts maintaining viewer attention

Bold, clear text overlays emphasizing key concepts

Motion graphics (arrows, circles, boxes) highlighting chart areas

Professional color grading suitable for financial education

Clean audio mixing with background music

Smooth transitions between segments

Educational tone without promotional hype

Strong hooks in first 3 seconds





Compliance Standards

All content must adhere to strict financial advertising regulations:



No profit guarantees or specific income claims

No "get rich quick" messaging or hype language

No guaranteed win rate statements

Educational positioning only

Realistic expectations with appropriate disclaimers

Professional, fact-based presentation



Violations of compliance standards are grounds for immediate termination.



Provided Resources



Access to AlgoKings indicators on TradingView

ElevenLabs account for AI voiceover generation

Brand guidelines (logo, colors, typography, style guide)

Reference videos demonstrating desired editing style

Product documentation and educational materials

Access to Canva Pro for thumbnail creation

Initial content direction and strategy

Ongoing feedback and collaboration





Work Schedule



Flexible hours with deadline-based delivery

24-48 hour turnaround per video required

Weekly output: 8-12 short videos minimum

Monthly output: 2-3 long-form tutorials

Weekly content planning sessions (30-60 minutes)

Available for brief check-ins via Slack/WhatsApp

Timezone-flexible, results-focused





Success Metrics

Performance evaluated on:



Quality and relevance of content ideas

Script clarity and educational value

Consistent delivery of required video volume

Quality of editing and motion graphics

Video retention rates and engagement

Adherence to compliance standards

Turnaround time and deadline reliability

Minimal revision requirements

Proactive creative contributions

Communication responsiveness

Growth in views and engagement metrics





Tools & Equipment Required

Candidates must have:



Professional video editing software (licensed or subscription)

Motion graphics software (After Effects or equivalent)

Screen recording software (OBS Studio, Camtasia, or similar)

Computer capable of handling 4K video editing

Reliable internet connection (minimum 50 Mbps upload)

Backup storage solution for project files

Headphones for audio editing

TradingView account (free tier acceptable, we can upgrade if needed)





Workflow Example

Typical Weekly Process:



Monday: Submit content ideas and script outlines for the week

Tuesday-Wednesday: Record screen footage, finalize scripts, generate voiceovers via ElevenLabs

Thursday-Saturday: Edit and produce videos

Sunday: Review, revise, and prepare for next week



This is a self-managed workflow. You own the entire process from ideation to delivery.



Trial Period

All candidates begin with a 1-month paid trial period to assess:



Content ideation and scriptwriting quality

Technical skill alignment with requirements

Ability to use TradingView and understand trading concepts

Proficiency with ElevenLabs or similar AI voiceover tools

Workflow compatibility and communication

Understanding of compliance standards

Ability to maintain consistent output

Quality and style consistency

Independence and self-management





Growth Opportunities



Potential expansion to full-time hours as company scales

Increased responsibilities in content strategy and brand development

Opportunity to build portfolio in growing finance content niche

Direct involvement in product launches and marketing campaigns

Potential to manage additional tea
mbers as we grow

Long-term stable position with expanding company





Ideal Candidate Profile

You're perfect for this role if you:



Love creating educational content from scratch

Enjoy learning about trading and financial markets

Thrive working independently with minimal supervision

Can balance creativity with compliance requirements

Take ownership of projects end-to-end

Are detail-oriented but can work quickly

Stay current on social media trends and algorithms

Want to grow with a scaling company

title: Google SEM media buyer

We’re looking for a results-driven Google SEM Specialist to manage and optimise our Google Search campaigns for a fast-growing Singapore chess education brand. This is a part-time role with performance bonuses and the opportunity to convert into a full-time position.

 with subject: SEM SPECIALIST.

title: Real Estate Asset Manger
description:
Overview

We’re looking for a Real Estate Asset Manager who can oversee property-level performance, drive financial outcomes, and guide strategy across a portfolio of commercial or multifamily assets. This role blends analytics, budgeting, operational oversight, and partnership with third-party property managers to improve NOI and long-term asset value.



Key Responsibilities

 • Monitor financial and operational performance for each asset, including occupancy, leasing, rent growth, collections, CapEx, and expense trends.

 • Review monthly property-manager reporting packages and identify variances, risks, and opportunities.

 • Build and maintain asset-level budgets, reforecasts, long-term plans, and investment models.

 • Oversee business plans and ensure execution against leasing, renovation, and capital program targets.

 • Partner with property managers to improve operations, streamline workflows, and resolve issues.

 • Manage lender deliverables, reporting packages, DSCR requirements, reserves, and compliance.

 • Lead hold/sell analysis, valuation models, and investor updates across assigned assets.

 • Track market fundamentals, rent comps, sales comps, and local operating conditions.

 • Support acquisitions with underwriting, due diligence, and transition plans when needed.

 • Maintain internal dashboards, KPIs, and performance summaries for leadership.



Qualifications

 • Experience in real estate asset management, property operations, or acquisitions.

 • Strong understanding of financial statements, budgets, NOI drivers, and investment metrics.

 • Proficiency with Excel, financial modeling, and property-management systems (Yardi, RealPage, AppFolio, MRI, etc.).

 • Ability to manage multiple assets, deadlines, and stakeholders with a high sense of ownership.

 • Clear communication skills with property managers, lenders, partners, and investors.

 • Analytical mindset with the ability to identify issues quickly and drive solutions.



Preferred Skills

 • Experience with commercial or multifamily portfolios.

 • Understanding of CapEx planning, construction budgets, and vendor management.

 • Familiarity with data tools, dashboards, or analytics platforms.

 • Strong organizational habits and the ability to work independently.



What Success Looks Like

title: Retention Representative
description:
Company: Davis Capital

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time



About Davis Capital

Davis Capital is a U.S.-based insurance agency that values teamwork, growth, and a family-like culture. We empower our agents and clients with clarity, care, and consistency. We’re expanding our remote team in the Philippines and looking for a Retention Representative who can build trust, solve problems, and strengthen long-term relationships.



Role Overview

As a Retention Representative, you will be responsible for engaging with agents and clients who may be at risk of leaving. Your role is to understand their concerns, provide solutions, and encourage loyalty through professional and empathetic communication.



Key Responsibilities

- Reach out to agents/clients flagged as “at-risk” and rebuild confidence.

- Troubleshoot issues related to billing, service, or plan confusion.

- Present tailored solutions, incentives, or alternatives to encourage retention.

- Document interactions clearly for compliance and follow-up.

- Collaborate with onboarding, support, and compliance teams to ensure seamless experiences.



Qualifications

- Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken).

- Strong interpersonal skills with empathy and professionalism.

- Negotiation and persuasion abilities.

- Analytical thinking to spot churn patterns and trends.

- Prior experience in customer service, retention, or sales (insurance background is a plus).

- Reliable internet connection and ability to work U.S. business hours.



Performance Metrics

- Retention rate (% of agents/clients kept).

- Call resolution time.

- Customer satisfaction scores.

- Number of “save” interactions per week/month.



Benefits

- Competitive salary (to be discussed during interview).

- Remote work flexibility.

- Supportive, diverse team culture.

- Opportunities for growth and skill development.

- Recognition for contributions and impact.

title: Permitting & Licensing Manager – Short-Term Rentals (STR / Airbnb)
description:
Elk Ridge Investments is a growing real estate investment firm managing a multi-market portfolio of short-term rental properties. We are seeking an experienced Permitting & Licensing Manager to lead and oversee all STR permitting, licensing, and compliance efforts across our portfolio.



This role is critical to ensuring our Airbnb and short-term rental properties are properly registered, compliant with local regulations, and proactively managed long-term. The ideal candidate is highly organized, systems-driven, and experienced navigating complex municipal and jurisdictional approval processes.



What You’ll Do:



- Lead end-to-end short-term rental permitting and licensing across multiple cities, counties, and states

- Obtain, track, and manage all required:

    - Short-Term Rental permits

    - Business licenses and business tax receipts

    - Local, city, and county registrations

    - Ongoing renewals and compliance filings

- Navigate varying STR regulations, ordinances, and approval requirements, including owner-occupied vs. non-owner-occupied rules

- Coordinate directly with municipalities and regulatory agencies to resolve permitting issues and move approvals forward efficiently

- Build, maintain, and manage a centralized CRM or tracking system for:

    - Permit and license statuses

    - Renewal deadlines and recurring compliance requirements

    - Fees, payments, and jurisdiction-specific obligations

- Ensure all filings, renewals, payments, and documentation are completed accurately and on time

- Develop standardized, repeatable systems that can be scaled across new markets and properties

- Communicate clearly with internal leadership and operations teams on compliance status and risks



What We’re Looking For:



- Proven experience with STR / Airbnb permitting and licensing across multiple jurisdictions

- Strong understanding of municipal, city, and county compliance processes

- Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail

- Systems-oriented mindset with experience building CRMs or compliance dashboards

- Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly with government agencies

- Ability to manage multiple markets, deadlines, and regulatory environments simultaneously

- Proactive, self-directed, and solutions-focused approach



What We Offer:



- Competitive compensation based on experience

- Opportunity to play a key role in protecting and scaling a national STR portfolio

- Direct collaboration with leadership on compliance strategy and risk mitigation

- Exposure to complex, multi-market regulatory environments

- Supportive, professional team culture with clear expectations and ownership



If you’re experienced in STR permitting, thrive in regulated environments, and enjoy building systems that enable long-term growth, we’d love to connect.

title: Marketing Executive
description:
We are one of the UK’s leading investment education companies, helping everyday people take control of their finances through practical, real world investing education.



Our mission is simple. We make investing clear, accessible, and actionable. Through expert led training, live events, digital content, and a highly engaged community, we empower our members to build long term wealth with confidence, without the jargon or overwhelm that often comes with investing.



Behind the scenes, our marketing team plays a vital role in delivering this mission. We ensure our message is clear, consistent, and impactful across every channel. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Marketing Executive who can help keep the marketing department organised, aligned, and running smoothly day to day.



What would I be doing?



Working for Investment Mastery, you will play a central role in supporting and coordinating the marketing department.



As our Marketing Executive, you will act as the organisational backbone of the team. You will help turn strategy into action by coordinating people, projects, and priorities across the department. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys structure, ownership, and being at the centre of how a team operates.



You will work closely with the Marketing Manager and the wider marketing team, supporting campaign delivery, managing organic activity, and ensuring tasks are clearly assigned, tracked, and completed. Alongside this, you will develop your own investing knowledge through our internal training programmes, giving you the opportunity to grow professionally while building your own path toward financial independence.



What would my day to day look like?



In short, you will help keep the marketing department running smoothly, efficiently, and on track. More specifically, you will:



• Work under the leadership of a supportive Marketing Manager who values collaboration, clarity, and team development

• Attend marketing meetings, take clear and structured notes, and document decisions and action points

• Delegate, assign, and track tasks across the marketing team, following up to ensure deadlines are met

• Act as a key point of coordination between different marketing functions such as content, paid, organic, and CRM

• Manage the day to day operations of the marketing department and help keep projects organised and on schedule

• Oversee and support the organic marketing side of the business, ensuring consistency across channels

• Maintain marketing plans, calendars, and internal documentation so the team stays aligned

• Support campaign execution by coordinating assets, timelines, and approvals

• Identify inefficiencies or bottlenecks and suggest improvements to processes and workflows

• Ensure messaging and branding remain consistent across all marketing activity

• Support the wider marketing team with ad hoc tasks that help initiatives run smoothly



The Ideal Candidate



• Highly organised and proactive, with a natural ability to keep people and projects on track

• Comfortable working in a fast paced environment and managing multiple priorities

• Confident coordinating teams, assigning tasks, and following up clearly and professionally

• Strong attention to detail and able to capture and communicate clear actions fro
etings

• Enjoys managing the day to day running of a department rather than focusing on one narrow specialism

• Has a solid understanding of organic marketing and content led growth

• Communicates clearly and calmly with a range of stakeholders

• Interested in marketing systems, structure, and continuous improvement

• Curious about investing and personal finance, although prior knowledge is not essential

title: Scheduling Assistant II
description:
Position Overview: 



The Scheduling Assistant is responsible for managing and coordinating various administrative tasks, including handling permits, warranties, inspections, and other ad hoc duties to support the Resource Department. This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. 



 



Pay Range: $7 per hour with a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 



About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 



Objectives: 



Ensure all permits, inspections, and warranties are scheduled and processed promptly, adhering to departmental timelines and requirements. 



Maintain accurate records of permits, inspections, and warranty-related activities to ensure compliance with local regulations and industry standards. 



Provide administrative support to the Resource and Admin Operations Department by handling various ad hoc tasks and projects as needed. 



Facilitate clear and efficient communication between internal teams, clients, and external partners to enhance project coordination and client satisfaction. 



 



Competencies:

title: Senior Wix Website Builder & SEO Specialist
description:
Overview



I am looking for a highly experienced Wix expert to take full ownership of building and optimizing my website.



I already have:

 • The vision and structure

 • All copy and brand direction

 • All image assets



What I need is someone who is technically fluent in Wix and SEO, can work independently, and can build this site better than I could myself.



This is not an entry-level role.



?



Key Responsibilities



Wix Website Development

 • Build and refine pages in Wix with strong attention to:

 • Layout, spacing, alignment, and visual hierarchy

 • Desktop, tablet, and mobile responsiveness

 • Clean section structure (no unwanted borders, padding, or white frames)

 • Confident use of Wix features including:

 • Strips, repeaters, anchors, buttons, hover effects

 • Forms and basic integrations

 • CMS collections (if needed)

 • Ensure the site looks polished, intentional, and professional



SEO & Site Optimization

 • Implement on-page SEO best practices in Wix:

 • Page titles, meta descriptions, header structure (H1–H4)

 • Image optimization (file size, naming, alt text)

 • Clean URL structure and internal linking

 • Optimize pages for:

 • Mobile performance

 • Search visibility

 • Clear user flow and readability



Independent Execution

 • Work without needing step-by-step instructions

 • Anticipate and resolve technical issues independently

 • Make smart structural decisions and flag improvements when needed



?



Required Skills & Experience

 • Advanced experience with Wix (mandatory)

 • Strong understanding of SEO fundamentals and implementation

 • Proven ability to build complete Wix websites independently

 • Excellent attention to detail

 • Reliable communication and follow-through



?



Important Notes (Please Read Carefully)

 • This role is not suitable for beginners or trainees

 • If you rely on tutorials or AI tools to complete basic Wix tasks, this role is not a fit

 • You should already be comfortable troubleshooting Wix issues on your own

 • I am looking for someone who can move efficiently and confidently



?



To Apply



Please include:

 1. 2–3 Wix websites you have built (live links required)

 2. A brief description of your SEO experience

 3. Your hourly rate

 4. Confirmation that you are comfortable working independently in Wix



Please answer this question in your application:

How long would you estimate it takes to build a 5–7 page Wix site if all copy and images are already provided?



Applications without Wix examples will not be considered.

title: Shopify Developer - B2B and Rapnet Integration
description:
Project Overview



We are building The Diamond Project, a secure B2B-only digital commerce platform for a professional diamond trading business. The goal is to replace a manual, CSV-based inventory process with an automated, access-controlled system that integrates directly with RapNet for daily inventory updates.

You will be working alongside an experienced Solution Architect who will help guide technical decisions, collaborate on complex areas, and actively contribute to portions of the build. This is a hands-on, collaborative engagement—not a solo or unsupported role.

This is a fixed-scope, build-focused contract. You will be responsible for your work product. However, overall QA, testing, and ongoing enhancements will be handled internally after delivery.



Key Responsibilities

Customize a modern Shopify Online Store 2.0 theme for a professional B2B experience using Edge Theme

Implement a gated storefront:

Public users see only the homepage

Full access requires registration, admin approval, and login

Build a custom integration with RapNet:

Secure API connection

Daily automated inventory sync

Map RapNet data to Shopify products and metafields

Eliminate manual CSV uploads

Configure structured product attributes (cut, clarity, certification, etc.)

Convert the website into WebApp for Apple Store and Android

Implement buyer document upload (license / ID) and admin approval workflow

Enforce secure access control and admin governance

Collaborate with the Solution Architect on design, implementation, and integration tasks

Deploy the solution and provide a brief technical handover



Required Skills

Strong Shopify development experience (Liquid, Online Store 2.0, metafields)

Experience building custom Shopify apps or API integrations

Hands-on experience integrating RapNet or similar external inventory feeds

Solid understanding of access control, admin workflows, and data validation

Ability to collaborate effectively in a guided, team-based environment



Project Details

Contract / Project-based

Estimated effort: ~60-80 hours

Start: Within 10 days of job posting

Time zone flexibility acceptable



How to Apply

Please include:

Relevant Shopify projects (especially B2B or gated storefronts)

Experience with API-based inventory integrations (RapNet preferred)

Brief explanation of how you would approach daily inventory synchronization

description:
We’re a premium beauty + skincare education company that teaches founders how to launch high-converting cosmetic brands. We sell ebooks, a flagship course, and a mentorship program. Our content runs on Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Pinterest, and Skool. We move fast, track everything, and we like clean systems.



We’re a premium beauty + skincare education company that teaches founders how to launch high-converting cosmetic brands. We sell ebooks, a flagship course, and a mentorship program. Our content runs on Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Pinterest, and Skool. We move fast, track everything, and we like clean systems.





What You’ll Do

Manage daily DMs (IG/TikTok/Skool/YouTube) using our scripts and objection handling

Qualify quickly and route leads to the right offer: ebook, core course, or mentorship

Send checkout links, handle basic invoice questions, and recover failed payments

Book and run short closes when needed (10–15 minutes, video optional)

Push webinar registrants to show up with smart reminders and pre-seduction content

Keep GoHighLevel spotless: tags, notes, next follow-up date, stage updates

Hit weekly activity targets: qualified conversations, follow-ups, show-ups, closed revenue



Must-Haves

Excellent written and spoken English (native or near-native quality)

Proven experience in DM closing, appointment setting, or offer-based chat sales

Working knowledge of direct-response basics: hooks, urgency, social proof, clear CTA

Highly organized and reliable: follow SOPs and never miss a follow-up

CRM experience (GoHighLevel is a strong plus)

Comfortable working at least 4 hours/day in US Eastern Time



Nice-to-Have

Experience selling info products, courses, or coaching

Familiar with Skool, ManyChat, and simple sales call frameworks

Interest or background in beauty/skincare



Compensation

Base: $4–$6/hour (experience-based)

Commissions (paid on cleared payments):

Ebook: $5–$10 per sale

Core course: $40–$75 per sale

Mentorship: 8%–12% of collected revenue

Extra 2% team bonus in launch weeks if targets are exceeded

Clawback on refunds within 14 days



Target earnings for high performers: $900–$1,600/month at 35–40 hrs/week when activity and close targets are met.

Schedule

30–40 hours/week

Minimum 4 EST hours daily

You must be able to operate as an independent contributor from day one, rebuild and tighten operations, and support business growth with minimal oversight.This partnership is direct, business-focused, and high-expectation. title: Billing & Bookkeeping Specialist
description:
Role Summary:



The Billing & Bookkeeping Specialist is responsible for accurate invoicing, payment processing, and basic bookkeeping support using QuickBooks Online.



Most of this role focuses on daily and weekly billing tasks; creating invoices, recording payments, and preparing deposits. A smaller portion of the role supports bookkeeping accuracy by reconciling accounts and making sure information stays consistent between QuickBooks, scheduling tools, and inventory systems.



Occasionally, uncommon situations arise (such as refunds or payment reversals). When this happens, the specialist is expected to follow best practices, ask questions when needed, and document the correct solution. 



Key Responsibilities:



Billing & Payments 

* Create and send customer invoices in QuickBooks Online 

* Set up and manage recurring invoices and recurring payments 

* Record customer payments (card, ACH, check) accurately 

* Prepare and record deposits so they match bank activity 

* Apply payments correctly to customer invoices 

* Correct misapplied payments or billing errors when identified 

* Support basic accounts receivable tracking and flag past-due accounts 



Bookkeeping & System Accuracy 

* Match bank feed transactions correctly in QuickBooks Online 

* Reconcile bank and credit card accounts on a regular schedule 

* Maintain clean and accurate bookkeeping records 

* Ensure completed jobs are invoiced and payments are reflected correctly 

* Help keep QuickBooks, scheduling/calendar tools, and inventory systems aligned 

* Run standard reports (Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet) when requested 

* Notify the Office Manager or Owner if something does not look correct 



Exception Handling (Occasional) 

* Assist with correct bookkeeping treatment for uncommon situations such as: 

1. Refunds or canceled projects 

2. Payment reversals or chargebacks 

3. Customer credits or adjustments 

* Research or confirm best practices when needed 

* Document how the issue was handled for future reference 



Tools Used 

* QuickBooks Online (daily) 

* Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive) 

* Scheduling or calendar tools 

* WhatsApp for internal communication 

* Inventory tracking software 



Required Skills & Experience:



* Strong working experience with QuickBooks Online 

* Good understanding of bookkeeping and accounting principles 

* Experience with invoicing, payments, and bank reconciliations 

* High attention to detail and accuracy 

* Clear written communication in English 

* Ability to follow documented processes and meet deadlines 



Preferred (but not required) 

* Experience supporting U.S.-based companies 

* Experience with recurring billing or subscription-style payments 

* Familiarity with payment processors (credit card or ACH systems) 



Personal Qualities 

* Organized and dependable 

* Careful with numbers and financial data 

* Be proactive, not reactive — find issues before they become problems 

* Willing to ask questions when something is unclear 

* Comfortable working independently in a remote role 

* Professional and trustworthy with sensitive information 



Performance Expectations 

* Invoices are created correctly and on time 

* Payments and deposits are recorded accurately 

* Accounts are reconciled weekly with minimal errors 

* Systems stay organized and consistent 

* Issues are identified early and communicated clearly 

* Maintain a professional, organized workspace that reflects our brand. 



Work Schedule 

* Remote position (Philippines-based) 

* Consistent weekday schedule 

* Some work overlap with U.S. Pacific Time is preferred. Our tea
ets at 2:00 PM PT most days (early morning in the Philippines). Occasional attendance at a 9:00 AM PT meeting may be requested but is not required daily. 





To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."

title: Senior Accountant
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Controller / Operations Associate to manage the full-cycle accounting and perform key operational support functions for a portfolio of growing, dynamic companies. This is a unique, hybrid role for a detail-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is adept at both high-level financial oversight and 

hands-on administrative tasks.



Key Responsibilities:



Finance & Accounting (Primary Focus) 

* Full-Cycle Accounting: Own the monthly close process, including preparing monthly work papers and developing monthly financial packages for banks and investors. 

* GAAP Compliance: Ensure all financial statements and records adhere to Heavy GAAP accounting standards. 

* Accounts Payable & Expense Management: Oversee all AP using Ramp Bill Pay and manage credit card expenses and compliance using 
, ensuring timely syncs to the general ledger and following up on missing receipts. 

* Accounts Receivable: Process and send 1-2 customer invoices weekly via QuickBooks Online ("Save and Send"), maintaining the invoice schedule, and conducting occasional follow-up. 

* Bookkeeping: Perform weekly/monthly expense matching, categorization, and work toward a weekly soft close to accurately project expenses in QBO. 

* Sales Tax & Compliance: Prepare, file, and submit sales tax returns for multiple states (monthly, quarterly, and annual filings) using QuickBooks Sales Tax (compliance guidance will be provided). 

* Cash Flow & FP&A: Maintain a weekly cash flow quick report and a 90-day cash outlook. Provide light financial planning and analysis (FP&A) support as needed. 

* Payroll & 1099 Prep: Prepare 1099 contractor and main payroll runs for management approval, ensuring all contractor agreements are executed and vendor profiles are set up in Ramp. 

* Asset Management: Help establish and maintain an asset management and tracking system (e.g., depreciation schedule, cataloging tangible assets like computers) for tax and internal tracking purposes. 

* Monthly Revenue Recognition: Conduct monthly updates and attend a brief monthly meeting to confirm revenue recognition accuracy. 





Operations & Administration (Supporting Role) 

* Contract Management: Manage the lifecycle of 2-3 contracts weekly (NDAs, SOWs, contractor agreements) using DocuSign and maintain an organized client document repository. 

* New Project Processing: Execute the full setup of new customer contracts, including saving all documents, updating the Accrued Revenue Report, setting up the invoice schedule, and creating initial QBO entries. 

* Vendor Management: Set up new vendors in Ramp, save related contracts, and ensure proper recognition of any vendor accruals/deferrals in the monthly work papers. 

* Procurement: Manage 1-2 procurement items per month, primarily client registrations, renewals, and access extensions. 

* General Administration: 

1. Process incoming mail weekly (scan, save to GDrive, and task actionable items in Asana). 

2. Maintain and renew city, county, and state business licensing. 

3. Listen to voi
 reviews submitted via
 and task actionable items to staff in Asana. 

4. Assist with PEO transition and Basic HR coordination (moving from Paychex/Oasis to a new PEO like Rippling). 

* Special Projects: Participate in and tag-team various process improvement, technology, and automation projects to increase efficiency across all finance and operational tasks. 



Qualifications & Requirements 

* 2+ years of progressive experience in accounting, with a minimum of 2 years in a Senior Accountant or Controller role. 

* Mandatory expert-level proficiency with QuickBooks Online (QBO). 

* Deep practical knowledge and application of U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP). 

* Hands-on experience with expense and bill pay platforms like 
 (or similar, like Brex). 

* Demonstrated experience with monthly closing processes and generating detailed monthly work papers. 

* Proficiency with cloud-based collaboration tools (e.g., Asana, Google Drive). 

* High level of accountability, strong organizational skills, and a proactive approach to process improvement. 

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Executive Virtual Assistant / Project Manager
description:
JOB OPPORTUNITY: Executive Virtual Assistant & Research Lead Company: FISAL Projects Location: Remote (Philippines) Schedule: Part-Time (3–4 Days per week / 24–32 Hours) Hours: Australian Eastern Standard Time (Melbourne Business Hours) Daily Rate: ?1,000 – ?1,300 PHP per day (Based on experience and skill level) Probation: 2 Months



ABOUT THE ROLE FISAL Projects is a Melbourne-based portfolio company operating across media production and e-commerce. We are seeking a highly intelligent, English-fluent Executive Assistant to support the Director across three specific business units.



This is a high-responsibility role that combines research, sales, and creative writing. We do not require a simple data-entry assistant; we require a proactive problem solver who can generate leads and draft professional content.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. The Occupation Records (Media Production)



Lead Generation (Casting): You will be responsible for finding interesting career subjects for our documentary series. This involves researching unique professions in Australia/Thailand, locating contact details for businesses, and drafting initial outreach
s to secure filming permissions.



2. FISAL Talks (Economics Commentary)



Script Research & Writing: You will support the Director in creating video essays on business and economics.



Responsibilities:



Researching complex topics (e.g., interest rates, global trade, corporate strategy) to find accurate data points and news articles.



Drafting script segments and summaries based on this research.



Fact-checking arguments to ensure accuracy.



3. Black House Decor (E-commerce)



B2B Sales Support: You will identify potential wholesale customers (retailers, boutique gift shops, interior designers) suitable for our brand.



Outreach: Sending professional inquiries to these leads to introduce our catalogue and secure wholesale orders.



4. Executive Administration



Managing the Director’s calendar and
 inbox.

title: Creative Operations Coordinator (Full time)
description:
Role: Content Coordinator - Content Execution & Quality Control

This is an execution and coordination role, not a strategy or idea role.

Hours: Full-time (40 hours/week)

Location: Remote

Salary: ?40,000 – ?65,000 PHP/month (based on experience)

Reports to: Creative Strategist

Works closely with: Video Editors & Designers



About us:

We’re a fast-growing Australian eCommerce brand in the sleep & wellness space, helping people sleep better through high-quality, thoughtfully designed products.



We produce a high volume of short-form video, ads, and creative assets across paid ads and social — and we care a lot about quality, consistency, and execution.



We’re now looking for a Content Coordinator to help keep our creative pipeline organised, on time, and to a high standard.



About the Role



This is a coordination and quality-control role, not a strategy or idea role.



You’ll work closely with our Creative Strategist, who will provide:



Clear creative ideas



Detailed briefs



Direction on what needs to be produced



Your job is to:



Take those briefs



Coordinate with video editors and designers



Ensure all content is delivered correctly, on time, to a high standard, and within budget



You’ll be the person making sure nothing slips through the cracks.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Content Coordination



Receive and understand creative briefs from the Creative Strategist



Assign tasks to video editors and designers



Clearly communicate expectations, deliverables, and deadlines



Quality Control



Review all edits against the brief



Check pacing, captions, formatting, brand consistency, and overall quality



Request revisions when needed, with clear and actionable feedback



Project Management



Track multiple pieces of content at once



Follow up with editors to ensure deadlines are met



Proactively flag issues before they become problems



Budget & Efficiency Awareness



Be mindful of revision rounds and time spent



Help keep projects efficient and on budget



Organisation & Communication



Keep files, feedback, and folders organised



Provide clear updates on progress



Communicate professionally with creatives and the internal team



This Role Is a Great Fit If You:



Are highly organised and detail-oriented



Are comfortable managing creatives and giving feedback



Have great taste and feel for good ads and content



Care deeply about quality and consistency



Are proactive and don’t wait to be told to follow up



Can manage multiple tasks without feeling overwhelmed



Prefer execution and ownership over “idea-only” work



This Role Is NOT a Fit If You:



Primarily want to come up with ideas or strategies



Avoid giving feedback or requesting revisions



Struggle with deadlines or follow-ups



Dislike structure, checklists, or process



Need constant supervision



Required Skills & Experience



Experience coordinating content, creative, or media projects



Strong written English (for briefs, feedback, and communication)



Familiarity with short-form video content (ads, Reels, TikTok, etc.)



Basic understanding of video editing workflows



Nice to Have (Not Required)



Hands-on experience in video editing or graphic design



Strong creative taste and ability to assess pacing, captions, and visual quality



Experience working with editors and designers



Note: This is not an editing or design role. Editing/design experience is a plus only if it helps you give better feedback and manage creative quality.



How to Apply - Fill the form below:

title: GEO SEO & AI Visibility Specialist (ChatGPT, Google AI Overviews, LLMs)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a GEO (Generative Engine Optimisation) & AI Visibility Specialist who understands how brands appear inside ChatGPT, Google AI Overviews (SGE), Bing Copilot, Perplexity, Claude, and other AI-driven platforms — and can turn that visibility into qualified leads.



This role goes beyond traditional SEO. You’ll focus on training AI perception of a brand, improving entity authority, and capturing high-intent traffic and leads coming from AI previews and conversational search.



If you understand why ChatGPT recommends one brand over another — and how to influence that ethically — this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities

GEO & AI Search Optimisation



Optimise brand presence for ChatGPT, Google AI Overviews, Bing Copilot, Perplexity, Claude, Gemini, and similar LLM platforms



Improve entity recognition, topical authority, and brand trust signals across the web



Ensure consistent brand mentions, citations, and semantic alignment across high-authority sources



AI Visibility & Brand Authority



Design and execute strategies to make the brand appear as a recommended solution in AI answers



Work on entity SEO, knowledge graph optimisation, and semantic content frameworks



Influence AI outputs via authoritative content, structured data, PR placements, and expert citations



Content & Intent Strategy



Create and guide content that aligns with AI-driven user intent, not just keywords



Optimise content for question-based, conversational, and decision-stage prompts



Map AI prompts ? landing pages ? lead conversion paths



Lead Generation from AI Platforms



Track and improve lead flow originating from AI previews and conversational tools



Optimise landing pages and funnels for AI-referred traffic



Identify high-intent AI queries that convert into enquiries



Measurement & Reporting



Monitor AI visibility using tools (e.g. Peec AI, Perplexity tracking, prompt testing, log analysis, Search Console signals)



Report on:



AI brand mentions



Prompt visibility



AI referral traffic



Leads influenced by AI search



Required Skills & Experience

Must Have



Proven experience in SEO with a strong understanding of GEO / AI Search



Practical knowledge of:



ChatGPT & LLM behaviour



Google AI Overviews / SGE



Entity SEO & semantic search



Experience driving brand visibility + leads, not just rankings



Ability to explain why AI platforms surface certain brands



Strong understanding of content authority, E-E-A-T, and trust signals



Nice to Have



Experience with PR SEO, digital PR, HARO, expert citations



Schema / structured data knowledge



Experience in competitive industries (finance, health, SaaS, B2B)



Familiarity with tools like:



Peec AI



Perplexity



GSC & GA4



Entity explorers / Knowledge Graph tools



What Success Looks Like (KPIs)



Brand appears consistently in AI answers for target see prompts



Increase in AI-referred traffic and enquiries



Improved entity authority and brand trust signals



Clear attribution between AI visibility ? lead generation

title: Website Designer
description:
Who We Are -----



At Private Practice Elevation, we imagine a world where every private practice owner can reach the clients they love, expand their impact, and build the business and life of their dreams.



We do that through website design and development, SEO services, and by being a team that clients can trust to help them elevate their online presence.



Our ideal clients are mental health therapists who are building a group private practice or solo therapists who need a killer website to stand out and take their business to the next level. 



Typically, they struggle a bit with all this technical stuff, so we serve as their guide to help them succeed with their online marketing.



Who We're Looking For -----



We’re looking for a detail-oriented Website Designer to join our growing remote team.



Your main job will be to take raw materials — like copy, brand colors, and photos — and turn them into beautiful, thoughtful website designs that reflect our clients’ vision. 



While we’ve historically used Figma for web design, we’re open to other tools or platforms — especially those that speed up the design process or improve developer handoff. Whether it’s Figma, Adobe XD, AI-assisted tools like Stitch, or something else — the key is that your designs are clean, thoughtful, and ready for WordPress implementation.



You should have experience collaborating with developers and an eye for practical, functional design, not just what looks good, but what works smoothly once built.



We’re also looking for someone who’s not just creative, but process-minded. If you’re the type of person who enjoys improving systems and making things run more efficiently, you’ll thrive here. We’ve got a solid design process in place, but we’re always open to better ways of doing things.



While this role doesn’t require direct client communication, you should be comfortable taking feedback from both clients (via our internal team) and tea
mbers, and quickly translating it into design updates that reflect the client’s vision and goals.



Over time, we’d love to see you grow with us — taking on more ownership, helping lead design initiatives, and contributing to the overall vision of the agency.



You’ll report to the agency owner (Daniel), with day-to-day coordination and support from our Project Manager.



This is a remote contractor position. While our USA team works between 9 AM and 5 PM ET, you’ll have flexibility to set your own hours — as long as you’re reliably available to collaborate and meet project timelines. This position will start with 10-15 hours/week with room to grow.



Key Outcomes -----



The purpose of this role is to ensure that website design projects are completed on time (or faster), with high quality and clear communication — all while helping our clients feel supported and confident in the process.



The following is how we’ll measure your success:



• Design projects stay 90% on track or better, with deliverables completed on time and aligned with the overall project timeline



• Client feedback is consistently incorporated quickly and accurately, resulting in high client satisfaction and minimal revision cycles



• Designs are developer-ready, requiring little to no clarification at handoff and translating smoothly into WordPress builds



• The design process becomes more efficient over time, with noticeable improvements in turnaround speed and fewer bottlenecks



I• nternal design systems and processes are maintained or improved, helping the team scale, reduce repetitive work, and maintain consistency across projects



Areas of Responsibility -----



Below are typical tasks you’ll be responsible for. These may evolve as the role grows, but your main focus is achieving the outcomes above — not just completing a checklist.



• Manage your design tasks daily via Asana to stay aligned with team deadlines

• Interpret design briefs and understand client needs, goals, and visual direction

• Create website designs in Figma or Similar Platforms that are aesthetically strong, user-friendly, and developer-ready

• Build and maintain component libraries or design systems to streamline workflow and ensure consistency

• Prepare and package design files for seamless developer handoff, including notes on interactivity, responsiveness, and functionality

• Collaborate with our team through Slack, weekly meetings, and project kickoffs

• Respond promptly to feedback from the internal team or client, making updates quickly and accurately

• Source stock photography that enhances designs and fits project goals

• Perform quick design QA checks to ensure final WordPress builds match the original design

• Look for opportunities to improve internal design processes, templates, or systems

• Stay current with web design trends, accessibility practices, and UX best practices



This is a remote contractor position with flexible hours. While you can set your own schedule, we expect reliable daily communication and availability for team collaboration.



Here are some examples of the type of work we create: 



We’re not just looking for people who want to pick up some extra work, but for team-players who want to play an active role in the development of our business for the long term.



Systems we use:

Asana

WordPress

Slack

Google Drive / Docs



If This Sounds Like You, We Want to Hear From You -----



• You take pride in your work and care deeply about the quality and impact of what you create — from the smallest design detail to the overall user experience.



• You’re motivated by helping others succeed, and you see each project as an opportunity to serve our clients well and support their mission.



• You’re highly detailed and dependable — the kind of person who consistently delivers polished work without needing to be micromanaged.



• You’re proactive and resourceful, often spotting design or process gaps before they become problems.



• You enjoy collaborating with a team and can take feedback with a positive, growth-minded attitude.



• You’re organized and self-motivated, able to manage your own deadlines and tasks in tools like Asana and Slack.



• You’re always looking for ways to streamline the design process, reduce turnaround time, and improve how things get done.



• You’re comfortable using AI to increase your speed and efficiency



Requirements -----



• 2–5 years of experience designing websites professionally



• Proficiency in modern website design tools (Figma, Adobe XD, or AI-assisted platforms like Stitch) — ability to create developer-ready, responsive designs is more important than the specific tool you use.



• Strong understanding of web design best practices, user experience, and how to design for responsive layouts



• Experience designing websites that are developer-friendly, with clean handoffs and attention to functionality and layout consistency



• Familiarity with WordPress and how design translates to front-end development — no coding required, but you understand the basics



• Strong communication skills and comfort receiving and incorporating feedback



• Excellent time management and self-organization in a remote work setting



• Bonus: Experience designing for the mental health, wellness, or service-based industries





So…

• Would you like opportunities to impact the growth of our business as well as the businesses of our clients?

• Would you like a job that encourages growth professionally and personally?

• Would you like to work in a company that seeks to serve its clients above all else?



Here’s how to apply -----



Fill out our application form in full to be considered. Somewhere in the application, let us know the best gift you’ve ever received:




 



Thank you!
