Before we schedule an interview, I’d love to get a quick Loom video from you so we can get to know you better and move faster.

Please record a 1–2 minute Loom answering the following 3 questions:



 Questions to Answer in Your Loom:

- Tell me a bit about yourself and any past experience you have as a setter or in sales.



- Why do you want to be a part of our team?



- What makes you confident you can hit 100–150 conversations a day and consistently book calls?



Once you’re done,
 your Loom link to:





If everything checks out, we’ll follow up with an interview time.

Looking forward to seeing your video

title: Junior React Developer (Graduate / Entry-Level, Remote)
description:
This is a junior / graduate role with structured mentoring. Salary is based on experience and learning ability, with reviews after the first 3-6 months



About Us

We are Automate Solutions, a UK-based software and automation company. We build internal systems, SaaS platforms, and business tools for growing companies using modern tech stacks.



You’ll be joining a small, focused development team and working closely with a senior developer on real production projects.



This role is ideal for a recent graduate who wants to grow quickly as a React developer in a real-world environment.



The Role

We are looking for a Junior React Developer who is either fresh out of university or early in their career. You’ll help build and improve web applications using React, working from clear tasks and designs provided by senior developers.



We also exploring use AI coding tools (including Claude Code) as part of our development workflow, so you’ll learn how to work efficiently with modern AI-assisted development - a valuable skill for your future career.



You will be supported, mentored, and given time to learn - but you’ll also be expected to communicate clearly and take ownership of assigned tasks.



What You’ll Be Working On

- Building and updating React components

- Fixing bugs and improving UI behaviour

- Implementing designs into React layouts

- Working with APIs provided by our backend team

- Using AI tools (Claude Code) to assist with development and learning

- Collaborating closely with a senior developer for guidance and reviews



Requirements (Junior / Graduate Level)



Required:

- Recently graduated or graduating soon in Computer Science, IT, or similar

- Basic experience with React (projects, coursework, or internships are fine)

- Understanding of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

- Willingness to learn and take feedback

- Clear communication (Tagalog)

- Reliable internet connection and ability to work remotely



Nice to Have (Not Required):

- Good Written and Spoken English

- Experience with REST APIs

- Familiarity with Git

- Any personal or university React projects

- Curiosity about AI tools for coding



How We Work

- Fully remote

- Clear tasks and structured guidance

- Regular check-ins with the team

- Supportive environment focused on learning and improvement

- No unrealistic expectations - this is a junior role



What We Offer

- Competitive pay for a junior/graduate role

- Real production experience (not dummy projects)

- Mentorship from experienced developers

- Exposure to modern tools, workflows, and AI-assisted development

- Opportunity to grow into a long-term role if things go well



How to Apply

Please include:

- A short introduction about yourself

- Your CV/Application

- Any GitHub links, projects, or examples of React work (if available)

title: Join our team as a sales professional (phone, email, sms, live chat)
description:
Hello!







We are looking for a Sales Representative who is familiar with how to use a CRM to join our team. This will be a Sales and Support role and we are looking for someone who can mask their Philippine accent and aggressively pursue sales.. If you have a fear of rejection, this job is not for you. If you copy and paste responses when following up with leads, this job is also not for you.



We are looking for someone skilled who can help turn our CRM list of 45,000 into sales. You must be able to communicate via chat,
, phone, and text through our CRM and other tools.



We want someone who is willing to commit to only one job, so this is a permanent position and no other work is permitted. If you want to apply to this job, please let us know which book or movie changed the way you think? Please include this in the subject line of your application, not the application itself.



While we are looking for a sales and support teammate, if you have experience in design or spreadsheet management, please include that in your application. That is a huge plus.



Your responsibilities will include working on business development through lead generation and closing the sale, business support, and (BONUS) content or data (HUGE PLUS)



Here are the responsibilities in more detail:



(Business Development Part)

- Engaging Leads via Chat,
, Phone, SMS, Social Media and correctly qualifying them and closing the sale

- Correctly Updating the Lead in our CRM to update the team what they were interested in

- Sharing opportunities of improvement for the company to team leaders

- Completing Daily Tasks assigned to you

- Engaging in Tasks assigned to you in our Team Boards



(Business Support Part)

- Supporting our beloved clients every step of the way (via Chat,
, Phone, SMS, Social Media)

- Assigning, Updating, and Labeling Support Tickets correctly

- Following Standard Operating Procedures and Encouraging New Opinions with the way we do business



BONUS Points If you can do design or spreadsheet work.



You will be using the following tools:

- Microsoft/Google Products

- Click Up

- Freshsales (CRM)

- Intercom (Chat)

- PostScript (SMS)

- Shopify





Experience with these tools is a plus, but not necessary as we have training.



Applicants with the following Qualifications will be given priority focus:

- Having more than 2 years in BPO

- Proficiency with the Tools

- A pleasant people person

- Backgrounds in Sales



We are looking for someone who can commit 30-40 hours of undivided attention to our efforts, per week. This will be a full-time position.



If you are interested in this awesome job offer and would like to join our team, please apply to this job with your:



- Name, WhatsApp Number, and Phone Number (If different than whatsapp)

-

- Resume

- A few sentences explaining why you think you would be a good fit

- Desired Monthly Salary (in PHP) & Available Hours per week

- Ideal Shifts to work in Manila time (Morning, & Night/Split) Shifts







We are looking for motivated people and want to create an everlasting relationship! Thank you for reading and good luck.

title: Dental Call Center Agent
description:
***MUST BE OKAY WITH MONTHLY PAYMENTS***



TO APPLY: Send your UPDATED RESUME and a VOICE RECORDING LINK (via Vocaroo or similar) stating your relevant experience. Applications without both will not be considered.



Work Schedule

40 hours per week

Working timezone: CST

Schedule: Monday–Saturday, shifts scheduled between 7:00 AM and 8:00 PM CST



About the Role

We are seeking reliable and customer-focused Call Center Agents to support a fast-paced Dental Service Organization. This role is primarily responsible for handling inbound and outbound calls, clearly communicating with patients, and efficiently scheduling appointments across multiple dental locations and specialties.



Key Responsibilities

Answer incoming calls and place outbound calls as needed

Schedule new and returning (recall) patients for general dentistry and multiple dental specialties

Coordinate appointment bookings for up to 28 locations

Accurately enter and update patient information in the system

Provide excellent customer service and ensure a positive patient experience

Meet daily and weekly call center performance metrics



Typical Day-to-Day Tasks

Managing a high volume of inbound patient calls

Scheduling appointments based on provider availability

Assisting patients with basic inquiries related to appointments

Maintaining accuracy in data entry while multitasking

Collaborating with the team via Zoom for updates and communication



Must-Have Skills

Strong multitasking ability

Excellent verbal communication and customer service skills

Professional phone etiquette

Attention to detail, especially with data entry

Previous customer service or call center experience

Experience in healthcare or dental scheduling (preferred but not required)

title: Dental Claims Biller/Auditor - Must have experience
description:
***You must be comfortable with monthly payments for compensation.***



Schedule: Monday–Friday, CST hours

Between 7am-8pm (To be determined)



We are seeking detail-oriented Dental Claims Auditors to review and audit dental insurance claims with a high level of accuracy. The ideal candidates will be highly analytical, able to read and interpret Explanations of Benefits (EOBs), and confident communicating with insurance carriers regarding claim details and discrepancies.



Key Responsibilities

-Review, analyze, and audit dental insurance claims for accuracy and compliance

-Read and interpret Explanations of Benefits (EOBs) to identify discrepancies, denials, and underpayments

-Make outbound calls to insurance companies regarding claim status, corrections, and clarifications

-Compare claim data against EOBs and system records to ensure accuracy

-Identify, document, and report errors or inconsistencies in claim processing

-Accurately update and maintain claim records using internal systems

-Work closely with internal teams to resolve claim-related issues in a timely manner



Required Qualifications

-Strong auditing skills with exceptional attention to detail and data accuracy

-Solid understanding of dental terminology and dental procedures

-Experience reading and interpreting Explanations of Benefits (EOBs)

-Proficiency in Excel (data entry, tracking, basic formulas preferred)

-Working knowledge of Denticon

-Ability to communicate clearly and professionally with insurance representatives

-Strong organizational and documentation skills



Preferred Qualifications

-Previous experience in dental billing, dental claims auditing, or insurance follow-up

-Experience working with dental insurance carriers

-Familiarity with claim appeals and resolution processes



Key Skills

-Analytical and detail-oriented mindset

-Strong problem-solving abilities

-Excellent verbal and written communication

-Time management and ability to handle repetitive, accuracy-driven tasks

title: Dispositions Manager for Wholesale Real Estate
description:
About Us

LandCo Property Group LLC is a real estate investment company specializing in wholesaling, creative finance, and value-add residential properties. We work directly with motivated sellers and sell deals to a strong network of cash buyers and investors. We are looking for a sharp Dispositions Manager to own the back end of our deals and maximize assignment spreads.



Role Overview

The Dispositions Manager is responsible for marketing properties, managing buyer relationships, collecting offers, and getting deals to the finish line. This role is critical to turning contracts into closed transactions.



Key Responsibilities



Market contracted properties to cash buyers and investor agents



Manage and grow the buyer list (cash buyers, hedge funds, agents, investors)



Send deal blasts via
, text, and social platforms



Handle inbound buyer calls and questions



Schedule showings and manage access (lockboxes, walkthroughs, open windows)



Collect, negotiate, and select offers



Coordinate with Transaction Coordinator and title companies



Ensure clean handoff from contract to closing



Track buyer activity and deal status in CRM



Push deals to close with urgency and professionalism



Qualifications



Experience in real estate wholesaling or investment dispositions preferred



Strong sales and negotiation skills



Comfortable speaking with investors and agents daily



Highly organized and detail-oriented



Ability to work fast and manage multiple deals at once



Familiar with CRMs, Google Workspace, and basic real estate contracts



Strong written and verbal communication



Compensation



Base pay (hourly or salary depending on experience)



Per-deal bonuses or commission per closed transaction



Performance-based growth opportunities



Why Work With Us



Consistent deal flow



Clear systems and SOPs



Growth opportunity into senior or management roles



Work directly with ownership



Results-driven, no micromanagement culture

title: Social Media and Influencer Marketing Manager
description:
Kessel Media Group is seeking a talented and experienced Social Media Manager to join our team. The primary responsibility of this role is to develop, implement, and manage social media strategies that enhance our clients’ online presence, engage their target audiences, and drive meaningful results. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of social media platforms, content strategy, and analytics — with a passion for creativity and storytelling that strengthens brand visibility and engagement.



Responsibilities



Develop and execute social media strategies to support clients’ business objectives, including brand awareness, audience growth, engagement, and conversions.

Plan, create, and publish high-quality content across multiple social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn,
, X, YouTube, etc.).

Manage and maintain content calendars, ensuring consistent brand voice and alignment with clients’ marketing campaigns. 

Outreach to influencers via
, social media platforms, and influencer marketing platforms to initiate partnerships and negotiate collaboration terms.

Manage influencer relationships, including contract negotiations, content briefings, and ensuring deliverables are met on time and within budget.

Monitor, analyze, and report on social media performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for optimization.

Stay updated on the latest social media trends, platform features, and algorithm changes to continuously refine strategies.

Engage with audiences through community management — responding to comments, messages, and fostering meaningful brand interactions.

Coordinate paid social media campaigns and assist in budget planning and performance tracking.



Requirements



Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.



Proven experience in social media management, preferably within an agency or multi-brand environment.



Strong understanding of major social media platforms, analytics tools, and content creation best practices.



Excellent communication skills and ability to craft engaging, on-brand copy.



Creative thinker with a strong visual sense and understanding of current social media trends.



Strong organizational and project management skills with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.



Ability to work independently and collaboratively across teams.



If you are a creative strategist with a passion for social media, content creation, and digital storytelling — and you’re excited about helping brands connect authentically with their audiences and if you are a strategic thinker with a passion for influencer marketing and social media, and you're excited about the opportunity to work with top US-based influencers and leading brands, — we’d love to hear from you! 



Please submit your CV and a short audio/video introduction detailing your experience and why you’re a great fit for our team.. Only applicants who submit the requirements will be reviewed.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Accountant to join our team. The Accounting Manager will play a pivotal role in overseeing our financial operations, ensuring compliance with GAAP and US Taxation regulations, and managing financial reporting. This position requires a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) with a strong background in accounting, auditing, and taxation. The ideal candidate should also possess exceptional analytical skills and expertise in financial software such as Quickbooks and Microsoft Excel.



Responsibilities:



Financial Management:

Oversee and manage all financial activities, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting.

Ensure the company's financial operations are compliant with GAAP and US Taxation regulations.



Auditing and Compliance:

Conduct regular financial audits to maintain accuracy and integrity of financial data.

Work with external auditors to facilitate annual financial audits.



Taxation:

Manage all aspects of tax compliance, including federal, state, and local tax filings.

Stay updated on changes in tax regulations and implement necessary adjustments.



Accounting Software Expertise:

Utilize expertise in Quickbooks, Netsuite, and Microsoft Excel to streamline financial processes and reporting.

Implement and maintain effective accounting systems and internal controls.



Financial Reporting:

Prepare and present accurate and timely financial statements to senior management and stakeholders.

Generate financial analysis reports for decision-making purposes.



Cash Flow Management:

Monitor and manage cash flow to ensure sufficient liquidity for operational needs.

Develop and implement cash flow forecasting models.



Financial Strategy:

Collaborate with executive leadership to develop and execute financial strategies that support business goals and growth.



Requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Master's degree preferred).

Certified Public Accountant (CPA) certification is required.

Extensive knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and US Taxation regulations.

Proven auditing experience, preferably in a managerial role.

Expertise in financial software, including Quickbooks, Netsuite, and Microsoft Excel.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and leadership abilities.

Detail-oriented and highly organized.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Experience working with US companies





If you meet these qualifications and are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, please submit your resume and an audio introduction of your qualifications

title: Systems Coordinator
description:
Position Overview:  



The Systems Coordinator is responsible for creating, managing, and troubleshooting automation workflows in GoHighLevel (GHL) to support efficient operations across the company. This role requires at least one year of hands-on experience in GHL or a similar automation platform, along with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. In addition to system automation, this person will assist the Admin Operations Team with various ad hoc tasks and continuously seek opportunities to optimize workflows, eliminate inefficiencies, and enhance team productivity. 



 



Pay Range: $8 per hourwith a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 



About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems, LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 



Objectives: 



Build, maintain, and troubleshoot automation workflows in GoHighLevel to support streamlined operations. 



Monitor performance of active automations to ensure accuracy, functionality, and timely resolution of system issues. 



Work closely with the Operations Manager to understand workflow needs and translate them into effective and efficient automations, while coordinating with Admin Operations and other departments as needed. 



Identify inefficiencies in current processes and proactively recommend workflow improvements. 



Assist the Admin Operations Team with various administrative and operational tasks, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations. 



Troubleshoot and resolve Admin Operations Help Tickets with a customer-service–focused approach. 



Manage and update pipelines, triggers, automations, forms, and integrations as needed. 



Ensure all GHL data, workflows, and configurations are maintained accurately and consistently. 



 



Competencies: 



Strong understanding of automation logic, workflows, and pipeline management. 



High attention to detail to ensure accurate configuration and troubleshooting of automation sequences. 



Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify system gaps and propose solutions. 



Strong written and verbal communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. 



Proficiency in GoHighLevel or similar automation platforms (HubSpot, Zapier, Make, Zoho, ActiveCampaign, etc.). 



Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. 



Proactive mindset with a drive for continuous improvement. 



Customer service orientation when supporting internal stakeholders. 



 



Equipment Requirements: 



Must own a reliable computer or laptop capable of handling administrative tasks efficiently. 



High-speed internet connection to support video calls, cloud-based collaboration, and remote work. 



 



Education and Experience: 



At least one year of hands-on experience with GoHighLevel or similar automation platforms. 



Experience in operations, administrative support, or systems management is a plus. 



Familiarity with CRM logic, automation mapping, or workflow design is strongly preferred. 



 



Physical Requirements: 



Extended periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. 



 



Benefits: 



Growth opportunities in a well-established company. 



Ongoing training and professional development opportunities. 



Opportunity for advancement within the company. 



A supportive and collaborative work environment. 



Company-observed paid United States holidays (full time). 



Paid vacation. 



 



How to Apply: 



If you are ready to join Power Plus Systems, LLC, a well-established residential electrical contractor that values its tea
mbers and offers excellent benefits, please submit your application through the link below. 




/internationalform 



Power Plus Systems, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply. 



Join us at Power Plus Systems, LLC, and be part of our continued success as we embark on the next 20 years of excellence in residential electrical contracting!

title: DISPOSITION MANAGER / WHOLESALING EXPERIENCE (REAL ESTATE) Hiring!!
description:
Job Title: Real Estate Disposition Manager

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time | $1500/month + 1% commission on deal size

Start Date: ASAP



**About Us**

We are a fast-growing real estate investment company specializing in residential acquisitions and wholesale real estate. Our team is driven, collaborative, and performance-focused, and we’re seeking a proven **Real Estate Disposition Manager** to lead and scale our property disposition process.



**Job Summary**

As our Disposition Manager, you will be responsible for managing the sale of acquired investment properties to our network of buyers, including fix-and-flippers, landlords, and institutional investors. This is a critical role that directly impacts revenue and requires a confident closer who thrives in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.



**Key Responsibilities**

* Manage the entire disposition process from listing to closing

* Build and maintain strong relationships with a network of qualified buyers

* Price and position properties strategically based on market data and buyer profiles

* Create and distribute compelling marketing materials for properties

* Negotiate sales terms to maximize profitability

* Coordinate with escrow/title companies to ensure a smooth closing process

* Maintain a buyer CRM and track communications and deal status

* Provide regular sales performance updates to leadership



**Required Qualifications**

* Proven and solid experience (1+ years) as a Disposition Manager or in a similar role within the real estate investment industry

* A track record of closing deals and maximizing assignment fees

* Strong knowledge of residential real estate markets, especially in wholesaling and investment properties

* Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills

* Self-starter with the ability to work independently and hit performance targets

* Proficient with CRM systems (e.g., InvestorFuse, Podio, or similar)

* Understanding of real estate contracts, title/escrow process, and compliance



**Preferred Qualifications**

* Existing buyers network a strong plus

* Experience working in a fast-paced, startup-like environment

* Real Estate License (preferred but not required)

* Willing to work some hours on weekends



**Compensation**

* $1500/month + 1% commission on deal size

* Opportunity for advancement in a growing company



**How to Apply**

Submit your resume link and a brief cover letter outlining your disposition experience and notable deals you've closed.



Take the next step in your real estate career. If you're a proven closer ready to lead a high-volume deal pipeline—we want to hear from you!

Company: Nova Underground LLC

________________________________________

About Us

Nova Underground LLC is an underground utility construction company specializing in telecommunication projects. We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality services, including fiber and conduit installation. Our success is built on organization, attention to detail, and timely execution of our projects.

________________________________________

Job Overview

We are seeking a reliable, proactive, and detail-oriented Remote Executive Assistant to support our executive team. This role is essential in managing daily administrative tasks, improving communication flow, and helping streamline operations across the company.

• Travel & Booking Management: Handle flight and Airbnb bookings, including managing changes, cancellations, and refund requests.

• Process Optimization: Recommend and implement improvements to administrative workflows.

• Collaboration: Serve as a point of contact between executives, staff, and external partners.

________________________________________

Qualifications

• Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or in a similar administrative role.

• Strong organizational and time-management skills.

• Excellent written and verbal communication.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace.

, Trello, or Smartsheet.

• Independent, resourceful, and effective in a fast-paced environment.

________________________________________

• Background in the construction or utility industry is a plus.

________________________________________

• A collaborative and supportive team environment.

title: Expert Video Editor - Parity
description:
Type: Project-Based / Contract

Experience Required: Minimum 3 Years



About the Role

We are looking for a skilled Video Editor to support our content on a project basis. This role requires someone who can produce polished, professional-quality videos and collaborate closely with our team to bring our creative vision to life. Strong communication is essential — this is not a “just edit and submit” role.



Responsibilities

Edit short-form content including Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and short YouTube videos

Deliver clean, professional edits aligned with brand guidelines and creative direction

Collaborate closely with our team to understand feedback, vision, and revisions

Manage timelines and deliver projects on schedule

Maintain consistency in style, pacing, and quality across projects



Requirements

At least 3 years of professional video editing experience

Proficient in industry-standard editing tools (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve)

Strong understanding of short-form content pacing and storytelling

Fluent in spoken and written English

Highly communicative and responsive — clear communication is a must

Able to understand creative direction and translate vision into final output

Strong attention to detail and visual quality

Important Note on Style

We are looking for professional-level editing

Content should not look templated or “CapCut-style”

Editors should demonstrate intentional cuts, clean transitions, and strong visual judgment



Nice to Have

Experience working with brands or content-driven teams

Motion graphics or light animation skills

Strong sense of branding and aesthetics



How to Apply

Please submit:

Your resume

A link to your portfolio or reel (short-form work required)

A short description of your experience and your editing tools of choice

title: Graphic Artist | Graphic Designer– Branding (Luxury Wellness, Healthcare & Medical Practice)
description:
Studio Close is a high-performance content and advertising agency serving medical practices in New York City. We produce strategic video content and run Meta advertising campaigns designed to generate consistent, high-quality leads for our clients.



Graphic Artist | Graphic Designer– Branding (Luxury Wellness, Healthcare & Medical Practice)



Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented graphic artist to create high-quality, on-brand visual content for luxury wellness, healthcare, and medical practice brands. This is a per-deliverable freelance opportunity. We value results over hours and want someone who can consistently deliver exceptional designs.



What You’ll Be Doing:

Creating visually stunning graphics, ad creatives, and variations for social media and paid ads.

Delivering multiple creative options per brief (for example, 10 variations for $50 USD).

Ensuring all work aligns with our brand guidelines and aesthetic.

Generating high-quality images using Nano Banana 2 when required.

Producing content optimized for Meta ads 
/Instagram), with an emphasis on high-converting, premium designs.

Ensuring flawless use of the English language. Grammatical and spelling errors are 100% unacceptable.



Who We’re Looking For:

Experienced graphic designers with a strong portfolio showcasing branding, ad creatives, and social media content for premium or luxury brands.

Familiarity with branding, product presentation, and responsive design is essential.

Familiarity with Meta ad buying, creative best practices, and performance-driven design.

Strong attention to detail, especially in language, typography, and layout.

You will be working on time-sensitive projects, so you should be able to generate multiple creative variations quickly and efficiently.

Detail check: Add the words “MOTIVATIONAL QUOTE” at the top of your
 or in the subject line, and tell us your motivational quote for success.

Comfortable with AI-assisted image generation tools like Nano Banana 2.

Comfortable communicating and collaborating through Asana and Slack.

Able to follow SOPs, guidelines, and instructions accurately and consistently.

Able to respond within 24 hours for any revisions or feedback.

We are not looking for a basic editor. If your portfolio looks like simple Canva templates, this role is not for you. We need someone who can create heavy, polished, agency-quality designs.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:

Per-deliverable payment ensures your work is valued by results.

Freedom to work remotely and manage your creative process.

Opportunity to contribute to high-impact campaigns for luxury wellness and medical practice brands.



Deliverables & Compensation:

Example: 10 creative variations for $50 USD (per agreed-upon deliverable).



How to Apply

Send the following:

Your portfolio showcasing relevant branding, ad creatives, and social media work.

Your resume with references if possible.

Examples of AI-generated content you’ve created, if applicable.

The completed Studio Close Test Assignment (provided separately)



We’re looking for someone who can consistently deliver top-tier creative work that converts. If that’s you, we’d love to see your portfolio. Thanks!

title: Female Appointment Setter (Multiple Clients)
description:

This is a full-time role ideal for someone who is organized, dependable, and an excellent communicator. If you enjoy coordinating schedules, speaking with customers, and helping businesses run efficiently, this position is for you!



Key Responsibilities



-Schedule and manage in-person appointments for multiple clients



-Conduct outbound calls and messages to potential customers to set appointments



-Consider travel time and routes to ensure efficient daily scheduling



-Record and update appointment details accurately in GoHighLevel (HighLevel) CRM



-Maintain strong communication with clients and the internal team



-Suggest ways to improve scheduling processes and client satisfaction





Requirements



-Proven experience in appointment setting (preferably for in-person services)



-Knowledge of travel time and route optimization



-Excellent English communication skills — both written and verbal



-Highly organized and detail-oriented; able to manage multiple accounts



-Familiarity with HighLevel CRM or similar scheduling software



-Reliable internet connection and quiet home workspace



-Positive, professional, and proactive attitude







Why Join SSP Marketing



At SSP Marketing, we help local businesses grow by managing their appointment scheduling and customer communication. You’ll join a supportive, remote team that values consistency, teamwork, and quality work.



We provide paid training to help you succeed in this role. Pay adjustments may be considered after training based on performance and company needs.



How to Apply



Interested applicants may apply through this link:

title: (L&D) Learning & Development Specialist
description:
We are a US-based custom manufacturing company committed to innovation, quality, and service. We are looking for a results-driven Learning & Development Specialist to lead the design, facilitation, and continuous improvement of employee training programs across the organization. This role is key in enhancing employee experience from day one through effective onboarding, compliance education, leadership development, and product/system training.



If you're passionate about empowering people through learning and have a strong background in instructional design, training facilitation, and tracking development progress, we’d love to meet you.



Key Responsibilities:

- Design, implement, and maintain structured employee onboarding programs for new hires.

- Develop and deliver compliance training to meet company policies and legal requirements.

- Create engaging and scalable leadership and management development programs.

- Coordinate and document product and system training for different departments.

- Utilize LMS (Learning Management System) to assign, track, and report training progress and certifications.

- Collaborate with HR, team leads, and department heads to identify training needs and close performance gaps.

- Analyze training outcomes and make recommendations for improvements based on data and feedback.

- Ensure all training content is current, accessible, and aligned with company values and goals.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in HR, Education, Psychology, Organizational Development, or related field

- 2+ years of experience in corporate training, L&D, or employee development (not just general HR)

- Hands-on experience with LMS platforms and tracking learning progress

- Strong content development and facilitation skills (online and in-person)

- Excellent interpersonal, communication, and project management skills

- Knowledge of adult learning principles and instructional design best practices



Nice to Have:

- Experience in e-learning tools (e.g., Articulate, Canva, iSpring)

- Background in HR, talent management, or employee engagement

- Certification in Training & Development or Instructional Design



Why Join Us?

We're picky for a reason, we want smart, strategic, growth-minded tea
mbers who value fun, learning, and making a real impact. If you're energized by the idea of helping others succeed, learning fast, and contributing to a growing company, we’d love to hear from you!



System Requirements:

- Computer Processor: Minimum 5th generation Intel i5 processor or equivalent

- Computer Memory/RAM: Minimum 8.00 GB

- Computer Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX - No Linux, Unix, or any operating system other than what is required.

- Internet Speed: Running on a 5.0 MBPS plan or higher (Both primary and backup) - If your backup connection cannot serve as your primary connection, that does not qualify as a backup connection

- REQUIRED Headset: Noise-cancelling headset connected via USB port

- REQUIRED WebCam: At least 3 megapixels capable of 720p recording



***We’re picky. You must be smart, savvy, strategic, fun, and ready to learn fast and work hard. If you’re up for the challenge, we want to hear from you!

title: Procurement & Inventory - REMOTE
description:
About Cube Care Co.

Cube Care Co. is a manufacturing company dedicated to producing high-quality products for the healthcare and commercial sectors. We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Procurement & Inventory Specialist to oversee sourcing, purchasing, and inventory management to ensure smooth and cost-effective operations.



Position Summary:

The Procurement & Inventory Specialist will be responsible for sourcing materials, negotiating with vendors, managing purchase orders, and maintaining accurate inventory levels. This role ensures the company has the right materials, in the right quantity, at the right time, while minimizing costs and avoiding stock shortages or excess.







Key Responsibilities:

-Manage and oversee the procurement process, including sourcing, vendor evaluation, and contract negotiation.

-Develop and maintain strong vendor/supplier relationships to ensure timely delivery and cost-effectiveness.

-Monitor and maintain optimal inventory levels to meet production schedules without overstocking.

-Conduct regular inventory audits, reconcile discrepancies, and implement effective inventory control measures.

-Coordinate with production, operations, and other departments to forecast material requirements.

-Prepare and process purchase orders, invoices, and procurement documentation.

-Track and analyze inventory KPIs (turnover, shrinkage, lead times) and provide regular reports to management.

-Continuously identify opportunities to improve procurement and inventory processes.

-Ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations.



Qualifications:

-Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field (preferred).

-3+ years of experience in procurement and inventory management, preferably in a manufacturing environment.

-Strong knowledge of inventory management systems, procurement processes, and vendor relations.

-Proficiency in MS Office and ERP/inventory management software.

-Excellent negotiation, communication, and organizational skills.

-Ability to analyze data and make strategic purchasing decisions.

-Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills



System Requirements:

-Computer Processor: Minimum 5th generation Intel i5 processor or equivalent

-Computer Memory/RAM: Minimum 4.00 GB

-Computer Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX - No Linux, Unix, or any operating system other than what is required.

• Collaborate with a senior-level designer to help bring design ideas to life.

How to apply

 me. All communication should happen within the OnlineJobs.PH messaging.

About Counterpart

About Counterpart: We’re the Message Strategy Experts®. Our mission: help clients create customer-centric communication that’s clear, compelling, and under control. We’ve done this for FedEx, AARP, P&G, Progressive, Terminix, Teladoc, and Hilton. Counterparts work in many states, with concentrations in Dallas, Minneapolis, and Memphis, our HQ. Founded 2002. Five stars on GlassDoor. More at

title: Video Editor
description:
JOB POST: Professional Video Editor (Economics & Documentary)

Company: FISAL Projects (Melbourne, AU) Role: Part-Time (2 Full Days / 16 Hours per week) Rate: 1,500 PHP per day (Paid Weekly) Location: Remote (Philippines)



THE MISSION

FISAL Projects is a Melbourne-based media startup producing high-level commentary and documentary content. We are looking for a Post-Production Specialist to handle our two core series:



FISAL Talks: Complex, researched video essays on Global Economics, Business Strategy, and Geopolitics. (Style Ref: Vox, Johnny Harris, Bloomberg).



The Occupation Records: Cinematic mini-documentaries about careers.



THE ROLE

We are not looking for a "vlog" or "social media" editor. We need a Visual Storyteller. You will be given a complex script and raw "talking head" footage. Your job is to understand the economic concepts being discussed and visualize them using archival footage, data visualization, and motion graphics.



Responsibilities:



Narrative Editing: Editing 10–15 minute 4K video essays. Pacing is critical—you must know when to let a 
nt breathe and when to cut fast.



Motion Graphics: Creating custom assets to explain the script (e.g., animated maps, rising line graphs, kinetic typography).



Editorial Judgment: You must have excellent English comprehension. You need to understand the difference between "Inflation" and "Interest Rates" to select the correct B-Roll.



Audio Engineering: Professional sound design (SFX, ambience, music scoring) to elevate the production value.



REQUIREMENTS (Non-Negotiable)

Software: Expert proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro + After Effects OR DaVinci Resolve Studio (or other video production software). 



English Mastery: You must have near-native English listening and reading skills. You will be editing complex scripts.



Hardware: A workstation capable of handling 4-6K playback and motion graphics rendering without lag.



Internet: Fiber connection (Min 50mbps) is required for transferring large camera files.



THE OFFER

Rate: 1,000-1,500 PHP per day (Top-tier part-time rate).



Schedule: 3-4 Days per week (Flexible days, but must deliver on deadlines).



Stability: This is an ongoing role. We are looking for a long-term partner, not a one-off freelancer.



HOW TO APPLY

Subject Line: "Professional Editor - [Your Name]"



 us with:



Your Best Work: Link to a video essay or documentary you edited. (Do not send gaming montages or travel vlogs).



Workstation Specs: Briefly list your CPU/GPU/RAM.



Internet Speed: A screenshot of your speed test.



Answer this: Which editing software do you prefer for motion graphics workflow, and why?

title: HR / Recruiting & Placement Assistant in Healthcare, Nanny Agency or Home Care Services Industry
description:
Apex Social brings together experienced educators, therapists and care providers with families who have special care needs and provides personal & career development through a unique, collaborative work experience for Care Professionals in a new state or new country. 



Our Mission 

-Unlocking children’s greatest potential through integrating skilled Care Professionals into their family’s daily life.

-Empowering Children to develop to their fullest abilities. 

-Empowering Care Professionals by providing personal & career development, experiential learning and cultural enrichment through a unique, collaborative work experience. 

-Empowering Families by providing specialized, skilled child care and cultural exchange in the home through an individualized recruiting and matching process. 

-Empowering Schools & Universities by providing career coaching and support for their students and alumni to gain interdisciplinary paid work experience & continuing education in Germany, the United States and Australia.

-Empowering Tea
mbers by providing a collaborative, remote work environment with opportunities for training and growth as well as a commitment to our mission ensuring that we find purpose, fulfillment and a sense of belonging in our careers.



Role Summary: 

We are seeking a Matching & Transition Experience Virtual Assistant who supports the Director of Matching with families and care professionals – not only during matching, but through the critical transition phases before and after arrival. This role ensures that no one feels unsure, forgotten, or unsupported during 
nts of change.

You will help create a smooth, reassuring experience for:

          - Apex Care Professionals (ACPs) arriving into a new role

          - Families welcoming an ACP (first-time or returning)



This role combines clear communication, empathy, process awareness, and systems thinking, and plays a key role in strengthening trust and satisfaction during transitions.



Key Responsibilities

Matching Communication & Weekly Updates

-Prepare and send clear, thoughtful matching-related communications to families and Apex Care Professionals

-Ensure each family and ACP in matching receives a weekly status update, including:

     -What actions were taken that week

     -What progress was made

     -What steps are next

-Reduce uncertainty during waiting periods by maintaining consistent communication



Transition & Arrival Support

-Support pre-arrival and post-arrival transitions for both families and ACPs

-Proactively check in with:

-ACPs before arrival to confirm readiness, expectations, and key logistics

-Families preparing for a new or first ACP to ensure clarity and confidence

-Send practical tips, reminders, and guidance tailored to the transition stage, such as:

    -What to expect in the first days and weeks

     -Common adjustment phases

     -Communication best practices during early placement

-Conduct follow-up check-ins after arrival to identify concerns early and escalate if needed



Experience Optimization & Relationship Continuity

-Help families and ACPs feel seen, supported, and informed throughout matching and transition

-Provide an additional layer of human connection without replacing the Director of Matching

-Ensure continuity so that handoffs between matching and post-arrival support feel seamless



Process, Data & AI Support

-Track transition stages and communication touchpoints

-Use AI tools (Hormozi Gem, ChatGPT, Google Gemini, etc.) to draft, personalize, and improve communications

-Maintain templates while tailoring messaging to individual situations

-Identify recurring questions, friction points, or gaps in the transition experience

-Suggest improvements to workflows, templates, and timing of outreach



Cross-Team Collaboration

-Coordinate closely with the Director of Matching and internal teams

-Ensure communications align with current status, expectations, and decisions

-Escalate concerns or red flags promptly and clearly



Required Skills & Experience:

-Strong written English with a warm, professional, and reassuring tone

-High emotional intelligence and empathy

-Comfortable managing multiple families and CPs simultaneously

-Strong organizational and follow-through skills

-Confidence using AI tools and structured data to support communication

-Interest in process improvement and experience design



Personality Fit

-Calm, proactive, and people-centered

-Enjoys guiding others through change

-Comfortable reaching out, checking in, and following up

-Thinks in systems but communicates like a human



With minimum of 3 years work experience as Executive Assistant or the same

BA or higher post secondary degree 

3-5 years work experience in recruiting and placement management 

Proficient in Google workspace and CRM 



Work Hours: 8am-4pm EST (work weekends - hours vary)

title: Video Editor
description:
Job Title: Video Editor 

Department: Marketing

Location: Remote

Type: Full-Time



About Printfresh



Printfresh makes sleepwear and loungewear that's impossible to ignore - bold prints, joyful colors, and patterns that make people smile. We're a team that doesn't take ourselves too seriously, but we're obsessed with creating scroll-stopping content that matches our product energy. If you've ever wanted to edit videos featuring pajamas covered in martinis, tigers, or disco balls, this is your 
nt.



About the Role



We are seeking a talented full-time video editor who understands social-first content for an American fashion brand. You will edit short-form video content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and paid social ads. You must have strong visual storytelling instincts, understand what makes content scroll-stopping, and be able to turn around edits quickly.

This role reports to the Associate Director of Social Media and Influencer Marketing and works closely with our organic and performance marketing teams. In addition to supporting social and paid media, this role contributes to broader marketing, e-commerce, and brand storytelling initiatives, ensuring video content is effective across customer touchpoints.



What You’ll Do

-Edit Social & Marketing Video Content

-Edit short-form videos for TikTok, Instagram Reels,
, and YouTube, and others as needed

-Edit PDP videos and website storytelling videos (founder, brand, and product 
nts)

-Create compelling cuts that "pull viewers along" with strong pacing and storytelling

-Add text overlays, captions, music, and sound effects that enhance engagement

-Turn around simple edits same-day when needed



Support Paid Media



-Edit video ads for Meta, TikTok, Pinterest, and other paid channels

-Create multiple variations for A/B testing

-Understand what performs in paid social and optimize accordingly



Collaborate Cross-Functionally



-Work cross-functionally within Marketing to understand content goals, brand voice, and use cases

-Able to translate creative direction and briefs into a strong first cut

-Understand feedback and incorporate quickly

-Proactively suggest editing approaches and improvements

-Maintain organized project files and asset libraries



Qualifications, Experience & Skills



Required Experience



-2+ years editing short-form video content for social media

-Portfolio demonstrating work for American fashion, lifestyle, or DTC brands

-Experience editing for TikTok and Instagram Reels specifically

-Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro 

-Familiarity with CapCut as a supplemental editing tool



Required Skills



-Strong visual storytelling instincts

-Ability to interpret a creative brief and shape a clear narrative

-Excellent sense of pacing, timing, and music selection

-Proficiency in written and spoken American English with strong grasp of American tone, humor, and cultural context

-Understanding of social platform performance and paid social ad best practices

-Strong attention to detail and ability to work quickly without sacrificing quality



Nice to Have

-Motion graphics and animation skills (After Effects)

-Ability to shoot simple content (not just edit)



Reporting & Communication

-Communicate clearly and professionally with marketing tea
mbers via Slack and video calls

-Participate in creative reviews, feedback sessions, and team syncs as needed

-Manage feedback efficiently and iterate quickly on edits

-Able to join video calls for creative reviews and team syncs

-Able to turn around urgent requests within 24 hours



Work Requirements & Arrangement

-Full-time, $ 1,500 - $ 2,000 monthly salary (depending on experience).

-Required work hours: 9:00 AM – 5:30PM Eastern Time (US)

-Fully remote

-Comfortable working asynchronously via Slack



To Apply

Please submit:

Your resume and answers to our questionnaire (form found below)

A portfolio link (submission in form)

A completed test project (details in the form below)





This should take approximately 20–30 minutes and help us see your editing style in action. 



Please answer the following questions in this form. This is how we will view your application:

title: Loan Processor / Junior Underwriter (Real Estate Lending)
description:
Location: Remote (U.S.-based preferred)

Schedule: Monday–Friday | 9:00am–5:00pm EST

Company: Alpha Capital Lending



About Alpha Capital Lending



Alpha Capital Lending is a fast-growing real estate lending platform providing financing solutions to real estate investors nationwide. We specialize in DSCR loans, bridge loans, fix-and-flip financing, and rental property loans for experienced investors.



Our mission is to build a best-in-class lending operation where originators focus on relationships and growth — and execution is handled with precision, speed, and professionalism.



?



Role Overview



We are hiring a Loan Processor / Junior Underwriter to manage loans from initial quote through closing. This role is critical to our ability to scale.



You will act as the operational backbone of the lending team — owning document collection, underwriting preparation, lender submissions, and closing coordination — allowing loan originators to focus exclusively on originating new business.



This is a high-accountability, high-impact role ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced lending environment and takes pride in clean execution.



?



Key Responsibilities



Loan Processing & Deal Management

    •    Manage loans end-to-end from initial quote through closing

    •    Collect, organize, and review borrower and property documentation

    •    Maintain complete, accurate, and lender-ready loan files

    •    Proactively follow up with borrowers to ensure timely document delivery



Underwriting & Deal Packaging

    •    Assist with underwriting analysis (DSCR, LTV, LTC, rents, rehab, exit strategy)

    •    Prepare professional loan summaries, sources & uses, and deal narratives

    •    Ensure all submissions meet lender guidelines and requirements



Lender Submissions & Capital Markets Coordination

    •    Submit loan packages to multiple lender partners on behalf of originators

    •    Track and compare loan terms, conditions, fees, and timelines

    •    Act as the primary point of contact with lenders during underwriting

    •    Manage lender questions, conditions, and follow-ups



Closing & Transaction Coordination

    •    Order appraisals and third-party reports

    •    Coordinate with title companies, attorneys, insurance providers, and lenders

    •    Track conditions and deadlines through closing

    •    Schedule closings and ensure smooth execution to funding



Systems & Process Management

    •    Update CRM and internal systems with accurate deal status

    •    Maintain internal checklists and pipelines

    •    Continuously improve internal processes and documentation workflows



?



What Success Looks Like in This Role

    •    Loan files are clean, complete, and submitted correctly the first time

    •    Lenders respond quickly due to high-quality submissions

    •    Closings happen on time with minimal friction

    •    Originators spend zero time on processing, underwriting, or admin work



?



Qualifications



Required

    •    2+ years experience in loan processing, underwriting, or real estate lending operations

    •    Experience with DSCR, bridge, fix-and-flip, or investment property loans

    •    Strong understanding of loan documentation and underwriting fundamentals

    •    Exceptional organization, follow-up, and attention to detail

    •    Ability to manage multiple deals simultaneously

    •    Comfortable working directly with lenders and borrowers



Preferred

    •    Experience submitting loans to multiple lender relationships

    •    Background in commercial or non-QM lending

    •    Experience working in a high-volume lending environment

    •    Familiarity with CRMs and loan tracking systems



?



Compensation & Growth

    •    Competitive base salary (based on experience)

    •    Performance-based bonuses tied to closings and execution quality

    •    Long-term growth opportunity as Alpha Capital Lending scales

    •    Potential to grow into Senior Processor or Underwriting Manager role



?



Why Join Alpha Capital Lending

    •    Remote role with clear expectations and accountability

    •    Fast-growing platform with strong deal flow

    •    Direct impact on company growth and scalability

    •    High-performance culture focused on execution and results



?



How to Apply



Submit your resume along with a brief explanation of your experience processing or underwriting real estate loans. Candidates with direct lender-submission experience will be prioritized. Please include a smiley face in the subject line of your application.

As a forward-thinking and innovative firm, we are dedicated to delivering top-tier services for our clients and partners. We are currently seeking a highly motivated Real Estate Sales Acquisition Specialist to join our team and help us expand our portfolio by identifying new investment opportunities and facilitating property acquisitions.

Job Summary

We are seeking a strategic and customer-focused Acquisition Manager – Customer Relations to lead initiatives that drive customer acquisition while enhancing engagement and satisfaction. This role bridges marketing, sales, and customer success, making sure our first impression is impactful and lasting.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

• Develop and implement customer acquisition strategies that align with company goals.

• Lead and optimize customer onboarding and engagement programs to ensure seamless transitions.

• Build and maintain strong relationships with prospective and new clients to boost retention and satisfaction.

• Analyze data and customer feedback to continuously refine acquisition and communication strategies.

• Collaborate with marketing, sales, and customer support teams to ensure alignment and synergy.

• Manage CRM tools to track customer interactions and lifecycle stages.

• Report on KPIs and make recommendations for improvement based on insights.

• Represent the voice of the customer in strategic planning meetings.









________________________________________

Qualifications



- Proven experience in real estate acquisitions, with a strong track record of successful property purchases.

- Solid understanding of real estate market analysis, investment principles, and property valuation.

- Exceptional negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.

- Self-motivated, results-driven, and comfortable working independently.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

- Proficiency with real estate CRM systems and MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, etc.).



Why Join Us

• Opportunity to shape a core business function in a dynamic, growing company.

• Collaborative and inclusive team culture.

• Professional development and growth opportunities.

• [Health benefits, flexible work arrangements, bonus structures, etc.]

________________________________________

Apply Now

If you’re passionate about connecting with customers and driving meaningful growth, we want to hear from you. Submit your resume and and message us in our Whatsapp Number 
..

]

title: High-Level Executive Assistant with Project Management Skills
description:
DAP Brands is seeking a high-performing, resourceful, and exceptionally organized Executive Assistant with strong project management capabilities. This role goes far beyond administrative tasks. We are looking for someone who can think independently, anticipate needs, and manage mission-critical initiatives in a fast-paced environment.



Responsibilities:

- Provide comprehensive executive support, including calendar management,
 oversight, travel coordination, and day-to-day operational assistance.

- Utilize project management expertise to plan, track, and execute key company initiatives.

- Serve as the primary liaison between executives, internal teams, and external partners, maintaining clear, professional, and timely communication at all times.

- Prepare, organize, and maintain documents, reports, presentations, and confidential materials with a high degree of accuracy.

- Coordinate meetings, prepare agendas, capture action items, and ensure follow-through across departments.

- Support strategic planning efforts by helping structure workflows, processes, and deadlines to ensure successful project outcomes.

- Anticipate executive needs and proactively resolve potential issues before they escalate.

- Uphold the highest level of professionalism, confidentiality, and judgment.



Qualifications:

- Minimum 3 years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Chief of Staff assistant, or similar role supporting senior leadership.

-Demonstrated strength in Project Management including planning, organizing, and delivering projects on time.

- Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities without dropping details.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to confidently interact with clients, partners, and executives.

- Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., Asana, ClickUp, Trello), CRM systems, and cloud-based platforms (Google Workspace or Microsoft 365).

- High level of discretion when handling sensitive information.

- Tech-savvy, resourceful, and able to quickly learn new systems and tools.

- A proactive, solution-oriented mindset with strong critical thinking skills.



Please submit your application through the online form provided. 



- To be considered, you MUST type “MAVERICK” in the subject line OR in front of your full name if you are applying via our website (
).

- If you believe you are the type of EA who adds value, takes ownership, and thrives in a fast-moving environment, we invite you to apply.

title: AI Expert with Advanced Programming and AI Systems Experience
description:
We are seeking an experienced AI Specialist to join our team and lead the development of advanced AI solutions. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in AI programming, implementation of AI systems, and hands-on experience with the latest AI tools and technologies.



Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy custom AI solutions for various applications, including design, marketing, and automation.

Utilize and optimize AI frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.) and tools for project-specific needs.

Implement and manage AI-driven programs and systems to streamline workflows.

Lead the integration of AI technologies into websites, marketing platforms, and business operations.

Research and apply cutting-edge AI advancements to innovate and improve processes.

Qualifications:

Proven expertise in AI programming and development (Python, R, or other relevant languages).

Extensive experience with AI tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenAI APIs, DALL·E, and MidJourney.

Strong background in machine learning models, neural networks, and data analysis.

Practical knowledge of deploying AI in real-world applications, including marketing and web platforms.

Ability to independently create and implement AI systems from the ground up.

title: Remote Full-Time Accountant / Bookkeeper
description:
We’re looking for a detail-oriented and dependable Bookkeeper to join our team and support our property management operations. In this role, you’ll handle the day-to-day financial transactions related to rental properties, ensuring accurate records and timely reporting.



Key Responsibilities:

Manage accounts payable and receivable for multiple rental properties

Record rent payments, deposits, maintenance expenses, and other transactions

Reconcile bank statements and property management software records

Generate monthly financial reports for property owners

Track lease renewals, late fees, and tenant account balances

Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and year-end reporting

Collaborate with property managers to ensure financial accuracy

Maintain organized digital records and support audit processes



Qualifications:

Proven experience as a bookkeeper, preferably in property management or real estate

Strong knowledge of accounting principles and bookkeeping practices

Proficiency in QuickBooks, Buildium, or similar property management software

High attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent organizational and communication skills

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

Familiarity with rental property regulations and financial reporting is a plus



How to Apply:

If you thrive in a structured, numbers-driven environment and enjoy supporting real estate operations behind the scenes, we’d love to hear from you! Please send your resume (attached as a file)  with the subject line "I am your versatile Bookkeeper" to

title: Part-Time/Gig Illustrator & Graphic Designer (Educational Content & Books)
description:
We are seeking a creative and reliable Part-Time Illustrator & Graphic Designer to support the development of educational content through engaging illustrations and original character designs. This role focuses on creating visuals for social media, educational materials, and potentially illustrated books.



Time Commitment & Compensation

Hours: 4–6 hours per week or can be a Gig (occasional work as needed)

Trial Period Rate: $4 per hour

Post-Trial Rate: $6 per hour (upon successful hiring) with potential for increase



Key Responsibilities

Create original illustrations for social media and educational content

Design and develop characters for educational materials and books

Adapt illustration styles for different age groups and platforms

Collaborate with the team to visually translate educational concepts

Deliver finalized artwork suitable for digital and print use



Required Skills & Qualifications

Experience in illustration and graphic design 

Strong portfolio demonstrating illustration, character design, and visual storytelling

Proficiency in relevant design software (e.g., Adobe Illustrator/Adobe suits, Photoshop, InDesign, Procreate, or similar)

Understanding of composition, color theory, and visual consistency

Ability to meet deadlines and work independently

Plus if experienced with creating digital animation/video



Important Legal & Ownership Notice

All artwork, illustrations, characters, and designs created as part of this role will be copyrighted and owned exclusively by the company. If you are not comfortable with this arrangement, please do not apply.



How to Apply

Please submit a brief introduction along with a link to your portfolio showcasing relevant illustration and character design work.

title: VIDEO-FIRST EDITOR (REMOTE)
description:
VIDEO-FIRST EDITOR (REMOTE)



Dubai Real Estate Brand | Short-Form Video

We are hiring a Video-First Editor, not a social media manager.

This role is focused 100% on editing high-quality short-form video (Reels / Shorts) for a Dubai real estate brand with premium visual standards.

If your strength is video editing, pacing, visual quality, and storytelling — this is for you.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

 • Edit short-form video content (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts,
 Reels)

 • Work with:

 • Raw footage

 • Stock footage (Dubai lifestyle / city)

 • Deliver high-quality video drafts ready for review

 • Adapt videos to platform formats (9:16)

 • Apply feedback and iterate quickly



REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

 • Strong experience editing short-form video

 • Proficiency with CapCut Pro, Adobe Premiere Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

 • Clear understanding of:

 • Resolution (1080p / 4K)

 • Aspect ratios (9:16)

 • Export settings & bitrate

 • Ability to explain:

 • Source quality

 • Export decisions

 • Editing choices

 • Comfortable working with drafts + approval workflow

THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF:

 • You only use Canva

 • You focus mainly on images, not video

 • You rely on free tools with export limitations

 • You cannot explain your export or quality settings

 • You are looking to manage DMs, comments, or strategy

NICE TO HAVE

 • Experience with real estate or luxury brands

 • Strong visual taste (not generic templates)

 • Basic motion graphics

 • Attention to detail and consistency

TRIAL

A short paid test (48 hours) is required and focused only on video editing quality and workflow.

COMPENSATION

 • Part-time / Project-based

 • Competitive pay based on experience and output quality

 • Long-term collaboration possible for the right candidate

HOW TO APPLY

Please include:

 1. 2–3 examples of short-form videos you edited

 2. The tools you use (software + paid/free)

 3. A short note explaining how you ensure high video quality



Applications without video samples will not be considered.

To confirm you’ve read this description carefully, please start your application message with the word “Dubai”

title: Paid Ads Buyer
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Media Buyer to own our paid advertising performance across platforms, with a primary focus on Meta 
 & Instagram Ads). This role is full-time and in-house (remote), so please only apply if you’re looking for a long-term permanent position, we are not hiring agencies.



This role is ideal for someone who is data-driven, detail-oriented, and excited to work closely with creatives to improve ad performance through clear insights and testing.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Launch, manage, and optimize ad campaigns primarily on Meta Ads. Support campaigns on Google, TikTok, or other platforms where relevant.

- Plan and execute structured tests (angles, creatives, offers, landing page) to improve cost per acquisition and ROAS.

- Manage budgets, audiences, and campaign structures based on performance

- Analyze ad performance to identify winning and underperforming ads

- Communicate clear performance insights to the creative team

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve creatives based on data

- Analyze Shopify sales data to identify scaling opportunities, conversion bottlenecks and product-level performance

- Monitor competitors’ ads, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and platform updates to ensure best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong comfort working with numbers and data

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain performance clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior media buying experience required, but you must be sharp, analytical, and able to learn fast.



Nice To Have (but not required):

- Experience running Meta Ads

- Experience with Shopify analytics

- Familiarity with Google Ads, TikTok Ads

- Experience in eCommerce or performance marketing



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "Paid Ads Buyer – (Your Name)”. Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) What experience do you have that’s relevant to this role?

3) If you’ve worked in media buying/advertising, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

4) If a Meta ad campaign is underperforming, what steps would you take to analyze and improve it?

5) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

6) What do you want to learn here, and how does this role fit into your longer-term career plans?

7) Please attach your work portfolio or campaign samples

title: Instagram Content Curator / Aesthetic Feed Designer
description:
I’m looking for someone with a strong eye for aesthetics to help me curate and design a clean, minimalist, slightly luxurious Instagram profile using photos I already have.



I recently took some trips and have a lot of photos. Your main job is NOT heavy photo editing, but:

– selecting the best photos

– doing light edits if needed (color correction, cropping)

– arranging them into Instagram posts that look premium, cohesive, and visually pleasing

– helping create a strong first impression for a new Instagram profile



Think minimalist, modern, calm, slightly luxurious vibes (not loud, not over-edited).



Here are a few Instagram profiles that show the general vibe I’m going for (minimalist, clean, calm, slightly luxurious):



– 
 

– 

– 



These are just for style inspiration. The goal is to make the best possible feed using my photos through good selection, layout, and light editing.





Please include the word “aura” at the top of your application. Applications without this will be ignored.





This is a one-time project to set up the Instagram profile, but if we work well together, I may ask for help again with future photos / social media stuff.
