title: Senior Java Developer (E-commerce)
description:
About the Job:  We are seeking an accomplished Senior Java Developer to drive the development and optimization of our e-commerce platform. The ideal candidate will bring extensive experience in Java, microservices architecture, and performance tuning, along with the leadership skills to mentor a growing development team and steer complex projects to success.



Key Responsibilities

Application Design & Development



Architect, design, and develop high-performance, scalable Java-based e-commerce applications.

Implement microservices and event-driven architectures to ensure modular and resilient systems.

Performance Optimization & Scalability



Monitor, analyze, and optimize system performance, memory usage, and throughput.

Troubleshoot concurrency, threading, and performance bottlenecks using advanced profiling tools and techniques.

Technical Leadership



Mentor junior and mid-level developers, setting best practices in coding, testing, and deployment.

Drive architectural decisions and technology choices aligned with business needs and industry standards.

System Integration



Integrate third-party APIs, payment gateways, and services to enhance platform capabilities.

Implement caching solutions (e.g., Redis, Memcached) and messaging systems (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka) for efficient data handling.

Quality Assurance & Testing



Champion test-driven development (TDD) and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD).

Write and maintain robust unit, integration, and end-to-end tests using frameworks such as JUnit, TestNG, and Mockito.

DevOps & Deployment



Collaborate with DevOps teams to automate builds, deployments, and monitoring (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, Docker, Kubernetes).

Ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and seamless scalability in production environments.

Security & Compliance



Enforce secure coding practices, including data encryption, OAuth/JWT-based authentication, and compliance with PCI-DSS/GDPR where applicable.

Continuously monitor and mitigate security vulnerabilities and threats.

Documentation & Collaboration



Produce clear, comprehensive technical documentation and architectural diagrams.

Work cross-functionally with product managers, QA, UX designers, and other engineers to deliver robust solutions within agile sprints.

Continuous Improvement



Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and technologies to evolve and enhance our software development lifecycle.

Propose and implement improvements to optimize code quality, productivity, and operational efficiency.



Note: Please send a link to your updated CV with appropriate sharing access, failure to comply will not move forward with the application.



Qualifications:



5+ years of professional Java development experience, ideally on large-scale e-commerce or SaaS platforms.

Demonstrated success in building and deploying microservices, distributed systems, and event-driven architectures.

Technical Expertise



Java Proficiency: Strong command of Java 8+ features (Streams, Lambdas), concurrency, memory management, and JVM internals.

Frameworks & Libraries: Advanced experience with Spring Boot, Spring Data, Spring Security, Hibernate/JPA.

API & Integrations: Experience creating RESTful APIs, integrating third-party services, and working with GraphQL (preferred).

Database Systems: Hands-on experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB; adept at writing complex queries and optimizing database performance.

Messaging & Caching: Practical knowledge of message brokers (RabbitMQ, Kafka) and caching systems (Redis, Memcached).

Build & CI/CD: Proficiency in Maven/Gradle, Git, Jenkins/GitLab CI, Docker, and Kubernetes for seamless development and deployment.

Testing: Expertise in TDD, unit testing, integration testing, and test automation frameworks like JUnit, TestNG, and Mockito.

Performance Monitoring & Profiling: Familiarity with tools like VisualVM, YourKit, or New Relic for troubleshooting and tuning.

Soft Skills



Leadership: Demonstrated ability to mentor developers and influence technical direction.

Collaboration: Excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively with product owners, designers, and cross-functional teams.

Adaptability: Thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment, reacting quickly to changing requirements.

Problem-Solving: Proven analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solving complex challenges.



***Very Important: Do take note that the applicant is required to share their updated CV with appropriate access. Applicants who are non compliant with this will be automatically ignored.***

title: DIRECT RESPONSE VSL EDITOR
description:
We are looking for a high-speed, high-output Direct Response VSL Editor to join our team. We provide the scripts; you provide the visual storytelling, pacing, and "pattern interrupts" that keep viewers glued to the screen.



This isn't about making "pretty" videos—it's about making videos that convert.



### Key Responsibilities

Content Sourcing: You must be an expert at finding high-quality b-roll, stock footage, and relevant 
s/clips that align perfectly with our scripts.



High-Impact Editing: Mastery of pacing, sound design, and text overlays to maximize retention.



Direct Response Focus: Understanding when to use fast cuts versus when to let a point breathe based on the sales psychology of the script.



Speed & Reliability: This is a full-time role. We move fast, and we expect a high volume of quality output without constant hand-holding.



### Requirements

Proven Portfolio: You must show previous VSL or high-retention social media work.



Software Mastery: Expert level in Adobe Premiere Pro and/or After Effects.



The "Vibe" Check: Ability to match the visual style to different niches and audiences.



Efficiency: Ability to turn around long-form VSLs (10–30 mins) quickly.



### ?? Our Hiring Process

We do not hire based on portfolios alone. We value real-world execution over a highlight reel. Our process is:



Portfolio Review: We check your past work.



The Test Task: If your portfolio passes, we will send you a test script segment. You will be required to source the footage and edit it to show us your style and speed.



Interview & Hire: If the test task hits our standards, we move to a full-time offer.



### How to Apply

Please send your portfolio link and a brief summary of your experience with Direct Response. Use the subject line: "Fast VSL Editor Ready for Test Task."

title: Trustpilot Campaign Caller
description:
About Brands Capital Group

Brands Capital Group is a dynamic e-commerce company managing fast-growing brands across multiple platforms. We are committed to delivering exceptional customer experiences and maintaining strong brand reputation through proactive engagement and continuous improvement.



Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and empathetic Trustpilot Campaign Caller to proactively engage with customers who have submitted negative reviews on Trustpilot. This role is critical in converting detractors into satisfied customers by understanding their concerns, facilitating resolutions, and gathering valuable feedback to improve our service quality.

The ideal candidate is confident in handling difficult conversations, demonstrates exceptional empathy, and has a proven track record in customer recovery or outbound calling. You will serve as the voice of our brand during sensitive interactions and play a key role in protecting and enhancing our online reputation.



Key Responsibilities

Customer Outreach & Engagement

Conduct professional outbound calls to customers who have posted negative reviews on Trustpilot

Practice active listening to fully understand customer concerns and identify root causes of dissatisfaction

Build rapport and demonstrate empathy while maintaining professionalism throughout all interactions

Manage call volume effectively while ensuring quality customer interactions



Issue Resolution & Coordination

Gather comprehensive feedback and document customer concerns accurately in the CRM system

Provide appropriate guidance or assistance within company policies and established guidelines

Coordinate with relevant internal teams (Customer Service, Operations, Product) to facilitate timely resolutions

Follow established escalation procedures for complex issues requiring management attention



Reporting & Continuous Improvement

Maintain detailed and accurate records of all customer interactions and outcomes

Identify recurring issues and trends in customer feedback for management review

Contribute insights to improve products, services, and customer experience

Meet or exceed call quality metrics and customer satisfaction targets



Qualifications

Required Experience & Background

2–3 years of experience in customer service, outbound calling, customer retention, or recovery roles

Proven track record handling dissatisfied customers, complaints, or sensitive customer situations

Experience with follow-up calls and customer feedback campaigns is highly desirable



Essential Skills & Competencies

Exceptional verbal communication and active listening skills

High emotional intelligence with strong empathy and patience

Conflict resolution and de-escalation abilities

Professional and composed demeanor when handling negative or hostile feedback

Strong problem-solving mindset with a customer-focused approach

Excellent time management and ability to handle high call volumes efficiently

Meticulous attention to detail in documentation and reporting

Ability to follow call scripts, guidelines, and escalation protocols



Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with Trustpilot or other online review management platforms

Experience in e-commerce or retail customer service

Background in customer retention, win-back campaigns, or reputation management



What We Offer

Fully Remote Role: Work from anywhere with a stable internet connection

Competitive Compensation

Impactful Work: Directly contribute to customer satisfaction and brand reputation

Professional Growth: Opportunity to work with fast-growing e-commerce brands and develop your customer service expertise

Autonomy & Ownership: Take initiative in resolving customer issues and improving processes

Long-Term Career Path: Growth opportunities within the customer experience team



How to Apply

Interested candidates should complete the google form:





We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Video Editor
description:

We’re hiring a Video Editor to turn ideas, long-form recordings, and raw footage into high-performing short-form video content. This role is for someone who understands that editing isn’t just about making things look good, it’s about driving attention, retention, and action.



This is a part-time role (20 hours/week) for a detail-oriented, fast editor who understands social-first video and knows how to package content for growth.



Responsibilities: 



Edit short-form videos with fast-paced cuts, dynamic pacing, and light animations, inspired by top-performing TikTok and Instagram Reels

Transform long-form content (podcasts, Looms, webinars, founder recordings) into high-impact short-form clips

Add captions, on-screen text, motion elements, b-roll, sound effects, and visual emphasis to maximize retention

Package content with strong hooks, pattern interrupts, and clear visual storytelling

Maintain consistent brand look, feel, and editing style across all videos

Organize footage, versions, and assets to support a scalable content system

Collaborate closely with the content and marketing team to support campaigns, launches, and offers

Iterate on edits based on performance feedback and engagement data



Skills & Experience:



Proven experience editing short-form content for social media

Strong understanding of hooks, pacing, and audience retention

Familiarity with creator-led, coach, or consultant brands

Proficiency in tools like Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, or similar

Ability to follow brand guidelines while maintaining creative judgment

Fast turnaround times without sacrificing quality

Strong attention to detail and ownership mentality

Comfortable working directly with founders in a fast-paced environment



Please fill out the form to apply:

title: Chat Support
description:
NOW HIRING: FULL-TIME REMOTE CHAT SUPPORT AGENT

FOR HIGH-PERFORMERS READY TO GROW WITH A WINNING TEAM EXISTING FOR OVER 4 YEARS!



We’re an international team growing fast — and we’re looking for DRIVEN, MOTIVATED INDIVIDUALS who want to do more than “just get by.” If you're someone who takes pride in your work, thrives in a structured environment, and enjoys pushing yourself to new levels, this might be exactly the opportunity for you.



This is FULL-TIME, LONG-TERM WORK in live chat support. You’ll engage in 1-on-1 private conversations through text messaging platforms, helping users feel understood, entertained, and emotionally connected — all through the power of writing.



You’ll be trained, supported, and guided — but YOU BRING THE DRIVE. THE MINDSET. THE FOCUS. We’re building a high-performance team, and we’re only looking for people who are excited to show up every day and DELIVER RESULTS.





**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**



* Handle live 1-on-1 chat conversations with users from around the world



* Keep chats engaging, friendly, and emotionally natural



* Follow clear systems and structure while bringing in your own voice



* Stay focused and reliable during your assigned shift



* (Optional) Earn bonuses through high performance — if you smash your goals, you’ll be rewarded





**WHAT WE OFFER:**



* \$2.50/hour, always paid on time



* 3% commission on all your sales/conversions — uncapped



* A consistent full-time role with room to grow



* A motivated team that values effort and excellence



* Bonus opportunities for top performers



* A long-term path if you show consistency and results





**WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:**



* Excellent English writing skills — casual, smooth, and grammatically solid



* A reliable setup: laptop/PC and stable internet



* Ability to stay focused and mentally engaged for full 8-hour shifts



* A responsible, professional attitude and willingness to follow proven systems



* Experience in messaging, customer support, or sales is a plus — but your **mindset** matters more than your CV





**SCHEDULE:**



* Full-time: 8-hour shifts per day



* 1 FLEXIBLE day off per week



* Remote work — fixed shifts



* We expect consistency and accountability from everyone on the team







HOW TO APPLY:

* What level of English do you speak and write?



* Do you have stable internet and a reliable computer?

* What’s your phone number?



We’re only looking for people who are ready to go ALL IN.

If that’s you, we can’t wait to meet you.



Let’s build something great together!

title: General Virtual Assistant
description:
Hi, and thanks!



When you start working with us, you will feel welcomed, supported, and valued. You’ll receive competitive rates of pay and will be encouraged to develop yourself professionally and contribute to improving our business processes.

When you show yourself to be a great tea
mber, you’ll be promoted to a role worthy of your abilities and be encouraged to develop managerial and leadership skills.



We currently employ 12 full-time Filipino assistants who run and manage every aspect of our business. Most of whom have been with us for between one and five years. We’re looking for long-term, reliable staff who want interesting and challenging careers.



If you want to join our established and growing team, we welcome you to apply and show us what you can do.



About Us:

British Medical Experts (BME) is a leading network of expert witnesses, providing specialist medical knowledge and experience to support legal cases and clinical negligence claims. We pride ourselves on offering exceptional expertise across a variety of medical fields, enabling solicitors and legal professionals to deliver robust and accurate case outcomes.

You’ll need to be available for full-time work (40 hours per week)



THE VACANCY SPECIFICATIONS



You will be involved in assisting with general administration and ad-hoc tasks. There will be instructional videos to watch to show you how we work.



You need to work UK office hours.



Role Overview: General Virtual Assistant

Location: Remote

Department: Depending on Skills Assessment

Reports to: Operations Manager and/or CEO



As a General Virtual Assistant, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the efficiency and success of our business. You’ll handle a variety of administrative tasks, communication, and project management responsibilities, helping the team stay organized and focused on key goals.



Key Responsibilities:

• Manage and organize calendars, appointments, and schedules.

• Handle
 correspondence and respond on behalf of the company as needed.

• Prepare and edit documents, reports, and presentations.

• Conduct online research and compile data for decision-making.

• Monitor and update task management tools (e.g., Asana, Trello, ClickUp).

• Manage social media accounts and assist with content scheduling.

• Perform bookkeeping and expense tracking (basic accounting knowledge preferred).

• Coordinate with tea
mbers and vendors for project-related tasks.

• Ensure the smooth execution of day-to-day administrative operations.



Key Skills and Requirements:

• Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or similar role (minimum 1 year experience).

• Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to multitask effectively.

• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

• Proficiency in tools like Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and project management platforms.

• Familiarity with CRM systems, social media platforms, and
 marketing tools is a plus.

• Tech-savvy and quick to learn new software or tools.

• Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.

• High level of professionalism, discretion, and integrity.

• Flexibility with working hours to support a global team.



NOW THE PART ABOUT THE CLIENT



For the past 16 years, this client has been an entrepreneur, following a decade-long career as a dentist.

They are married, have a young family, and currently manage a medico-legal reporting and business coaching companies based in London, UK.



We are passionate about systems and improving the way things work. We strive to provide an outstanding customer experience, so we need the very best employees to help us achieve this goal. We believe in treating our employees in the way we would want to be treated - with respect and kindness.



You can find out a bit more about our company here: 
/



OUR COMPANY PAY AND BENEFITS

• Starting pay rate: Starting from PHP250 hourly rate (based on skills and experience)

• Weekly payment via Transferwise

• Flexible Hours

• Opportunity to work remotely

• Bonuses will be paid for exceptional work

7 We pay the 13th month as standard (pro rata) once the first full year of service has been completed

• Access to exclusive BME training programs and resources



NOW THE IMPORTANT PART - HOW YOU CAN APPLY:

Please note, that we ONLY accept applications through this application process. PLEASE DO NOT use the website’s message board, as we don’t monitor this.

 us to confirm receipt or send your CV - we will send you an acknowledgment within 48 hours of the closing of the application process. We will request your references from you if you progress to the interview stage.



I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Quality, Compliance & Performance Manager (Remote – Philippines)
description:
We are hiring a Quality, Compliance & Performance Manager (Remote) to act as the eligibility gatekeeper for our Amazon delivery drivers.



This is not a dispatch role and not a virtual assistant position. This role has independent authority and is responsible for ensuring that only compliant, safe, and performance-qualified drivers are cleared to operate routes.



You will track driver compliance, quality, safety, pace, rescues, attendance, and DCR metrics, maintain driver report cards, and place drivers on hold when requirements are not met. This role requires comfort enforcing rules consistently and documenting decisions objectively.



Key Responsibilities



• Maintain a daily Cleared / Not Cleared driver eligibility list

• Track safety, quality, and policy quiz completion and scores

• Enforce Compliance Holds and Quality Holds until remediation is complete

• Track quality defects and assign required knowledge checks

• Monitor driver pace, rescue frequency, and percentage of route rescued

• Track DCR on rolling 7 / 30 / 60 / 90-day periods

• Identify repeat patterns and escalation thresholds

• Maintain detailed driver report cards and supporting documentation

• Provide weekly compliance and performance reports to leadership

• Track driver attendance, late starts, call-outs, and no-shows

• Maintain attendance history as part of each driver’s report card

• Identify repeat attendance patterns and escalate per policy



Requirements



• Experience with Amazon DSP operations, logistics compliance, or performance tracking

• Strong Google Sheets skills (tracking, dashboards, data validation)

• High attention to detail and consistency

• Comfortable enforcing rules and saying “no” when standards are not met

• Strong written and spoken English communication

• Able to work independently and follow SOPs



Important Notes



• This is a full-time, long-term role

• Paid hourly as an independent contractor (not an employee)

• No subcontracting or delegation allowed — work must be performed personally

• Single-client role only

• Authority to block route eligibility is required



This role has the authority to prevent drivers from working if they are not compliant. Applicants must be comfortable enforcing rules without exceptions.

title: Tiktok Shop Creator Success Manager
description:
Job Title: Tiktok Shop Creator Success Manager 



Overview



We're one of the top TikTok Shop agencies in the US, ranking top 3 as the CAP. We work with 200+ top beauty creators generating $10M+ GMV monthly.



But we're not just a TikTok agency. TikTok Shop is all about affiliates now, and we use media to attract like-minded creators to join our journey. Surrounded with A+ creators, work on something challenging and exciting, and build real relationships and deep trust with the best ones.



The vision is to evolve into a media company + tech-enabled platform, using media to attract like-minded creators and together define the product trends on TikTok Shop.



The Role



We're looking for a Creator Success Manager - a mix of Creator Manager, Community Manager, and Relationship Builder.



You'll be the first line of contact with our creators. You represent our reputation. This isn't about following scripts - it's about genuinely caring and building trust.



Key Responsibilities



Manage daily communication with creators via text and calls

Conduct weekly 1:1 creator check-ins and support group calls

Act as the primary point of contact and brand representative

Build and maintain strong, trust-based creator relationships

Identify creator needs, blockers, and growth opportunities

Assess creator fit and engagement; flag misaligned or inactive creators

Onboard new creators and align expectations

Coordinate with internal teams to support creator success

Ensure fast responses and consistent follow-ups

Step in during high-priority or peak periods as needed



What We're Looking For



Straightforward: Say it directly. No fluff, no dancing around.

Hungry:You want to win. You care about results.

Aggressive: You take initiative. You don't wait for instructions.

Buy into TTS Vision: You see the potential of TikTok Shop in the US market.

Want to be surrounded by A-players: You want challenge. You want to grow with excellent people.



Requirements:



Fluent English - native or near-native level (calls + text)

Strong communication - no Al/ChatGPT tone, real human voice

Detail-oriented - catch everything, respond fast

Good judgment - know who's a fit and who's not

EST working hours, 8 hours/day

Willing to put in extra during critical periods (with bonus/overtime pay)



Our Values (How We Treat Creators)

title: AI Image Generation & Prompting Specialist (E-commerce) – Long-Term
description:
We are a growing e-commerce company managing multiple brands across kitchen, home, baby, outdoor, toys, and other categories.

Our focus is on high-quality, conversion-driven visuals for marketplaces like Amazon and Walmart.



We have built our own AI image generation tool, and we are now looking for a skilled specialist who knows how to prompt AI effectively, refine outputs, and push images to a professional, e-commerce-ready level.



This is a long-term role for someone who understands that great AI images come from iteration, precision, and visual judgment.



???? Your Role



You will be responsible for turning AI-generated images into usable, high-quality product visuals.



Key Responsibilities



Use our internal AI tool to generate product and lifestyle images



Analyze AI outputs and identify what needs improvement (realism, lighting, proportions, background, details, etc.)



Write and refine precise prompts to:



Fix visual mistakes



Adjust composition, angles, environments, or colors



Improve realism and consistency



Iterate until images meet marketplace and brand standards



Use Photoshop when needed to:



Clean up imperfections



Adjust colors, lighting, shadows, or edges



Make final professional touch-ups



Organize and deliver finalized images ready for listing use



? Required Skills



Strong experience with AI image generation tools (Midjourney, DALL·E, Stable Diffusion, or similar)



Advanced prompt writing skills for image refinement



Excellent eye for detail, realism, and aesthetics



Ability to clearly translate visual feedback into AI prompts



Comfortable working independently and iterating multiple times



? Big Plus (Highly Valued)



Photoshop experience (especially for image cleanup and enhancement)



Experience with Amazon / Walmart product images



Understanding of e-commerce visual standards (white background, lifestyle shots, hero images, etc.)



Basic knowledge of product photography or visual branding



? Work Details



Remote



Long-term collaboration (5-20h/week depending on tasks - the first 3 months should be at least 15h/week and can reach 30-40/week)



Flexible schedule, but consistency and reliability are important



Payment: hourly or per project (based on experience)



???? How to Apply (Important)



To be considered, please include:



A short introduction about yourself



Your experience with AI image generation and prompting



Your experience with Photoshop (what you typically use it for)



Examples of AI-generated images you worked on (before/after is a big plus)



The AI tools you are most comfortable with



Applicants who demonstrate strong prompting skills + visual judgment will be prioritized.

title: Amazon Catalog manager
description:
We’re looking for a remote Amazon Catalog manager who can help us boost our product visibility, optimize product listings, and ensure that every listing is fully optimized to maximize sales and conversions. If you’re passionate about e-commerce, product research, and driving organic traffic to product pages, this role is for you.

This is a long-term position, and the salary starts at $3-4/h, 40 hours per week with the possibility of working overtime.



Key Responsibilities:

-Account Management: Oversee day-to-day operations of our Amazon account, ensuring all listings, content, and storefronts are up-to-date, compliant, and optimized for performance.

-SEO & Keyword Research: Perform keyword research using tools like Helium 10 to boost product rankings, enhance discoverability, and drive organic traffic.

-Product Listing Optimization: Manage and improve product listings, including titles, bullet points, descriptions, and backend keywords, to maximize conversions and visibility.

-Brand Strategy & Consistency: Work to ensure brand consistency across all Amazon touchpoints, including listings, A+ Content, and storefronts. Help refine our brand’s messaging and position on Amazon to align with our growth goals.

-Collaboration with PPC & Design Teams: Coordinate with the PPC team to align paid advertising efforts with SEO strategies. -Collaborate with freelance graphic designers to produce high-quality images, packaging, and other A+ Content.

-Performance Monitoring & Reporting: Track and analyze account metrics, such as organic rankings, CTR, and conversion rates, to measure the effectiveness of strategies and identify areas for improvement.

-Customer Insights & Feedback: Review customer feedback and reviews to identify product improvement opportunities and refine listing content accordingly.



Requirements:

-2+ years of experience in Amazon SEO and listing optimization.

-Experience with Helium 10 or similar tools for keyword research.

-Familiarity with Amazon’s ranking algorithm and SEO best practices.

-Knowledge of Amazon’s listing requirements, guidelines, and optimization tactics.

-Proficient in SEO tools, AI content tools, and Excel.

-Strong attention to detail and excellent English communication skills.



Why Work with Us?:

-Fully remote position with flexible hours(preferably starting at 7AM EEST)

-Opportunity to grow with a fast-growing e-commerce brand.

-Access to continuous professional development and training.

-Bi-weekly payments and a supportive, international team.

-Other benefits will be offered after 6 months of employment, such as minimum days of paid leave, health insurance, SSS, and pag-ibig...



To Apply:

Please include your CV and the word ‘SEO’ in the subject line of your application to be considered.

title: Content Management Administration (Alfresco)
description:
Responsibilities:

- Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align Alfresco content management solutions with business strategies.

- Gathers requirements from business units and translates those to technical solutions within the Alfresco platform.

- Prepares cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation.

- Demonstrates an informed knowledge of content management functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities.

- Supports one or more highly complex business processes through Alfresco platform optimization.

- Works on multiple projects as a project team member, ensuring timely delivery and quality outcomes.

- Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions that meet user needs.

- Administers and maintains Alfresco repositories, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance with organizational policies.

- Monitors and troubleshoots Alfresco system performance, resolving issues to minimize downtime and ensure optimal functionality.

- Configures workflows, permissions, and access controls within Alfresco to meet business requirements.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering, or related field required. MBA or other related advanced degree preferred.

- 5-7 years’ experience required in content management administration, with a focus on Alfresco.

- Basic knowledge of programming languages such as Java, Python, or scripting tools to comprehend reading code and basic functions.

- Ability to create business solutions that increase competitive advantage using Alfresco content management systems.

- Ability to exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.

- Project management skills to handle diverse projects, often simultaneously, and meet aggressive deadlines.

- Ability to solve technical problems/processes and understand complex details.

- Ability to increase operating efficiency and produce high-quality technical solutions.

- A high level of interpersonal and verbal communication skills necessary to relate to other people at their systems knowledge level.

- Ability to analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to arrive at innovative solutions



Preferred Skills:

- Experience with Alfresco platform optimization, including repository management, workflow configuration, and content retrieval.

- Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure for hosting and managing services.

- Platform support for shared infrastructure components hosted on-premises and in vendor PaaS solutions.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with business and technical contacts.

- Incident and problem management experience.

- Knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements related to enterprise content management.

- Experience with Alfresco integrations, including APIs and third-party tools.

title: Junior Web Developer
description:
ABOUT DISPENZA

Dispenza has quickly become one of the largest marketing agencies in the rapidly-growing emerging market of cannabis as it quickly legalizes state by state in the Americas. As the market matures, we are on a mission to help change how the market operates, leaving the more questionable activities done by current market leaders and emerge as the first marketing agency and platform that values our customers while simultaneously delivering business-changing results to our clients.



JOB OVERVIEW

We are seeking an experienced WordPress Elementor Developer with a strong focus on front-end development, particularly in CSS and Bootstrap, to create high-end custom websites. You will play a crucial role in delivering pixel-perfect, fast, and user-friendly designs. No scripting or backend knowledge is required — just a passion for styling and optimizing websites for performance.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



FRONT END DEVELOPMENT

- Building and styling custom websites using a CMS similar to WordPress and Elementor, with a heavy emphasis on CSS and Bootstrap.

- Implementing clean, well-organized code and ensuring responsive design across all devices.

- Collaborating with the design team to bring mockups from Figma into functional websites.

- Ensuring optimal website performance (load time, speed, etc.) by leveraging front-end best practices.

- Customizing Builder widgets and templates to meet specific design needs.

- Troubleshooting front-end issues and providing quick resolutions.





TEAM COLLABORATION

- Working alongside project managers to complete tasks as part of the team’s development process.

- Participating in team meetings to discuss project progress and suggest new tools or techniques.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Expert-Level Front-End Development: Mastery of CSS, HTML, and Bootstrap for building responsive and visually stunning websites.

- 3+ years experience in WordPress, Elementor, and front-end styling.

- Proven experience with Bootstrap to build flexible, grid-based layouts and components.

- Proficiency with Figma to translate design into functional front-end code.

- Strong attention to detail with an ability to deliver pixel-perfect designs.

- Experience with API integrations at the front-end level (e.g., integrating third-party services or data into the front end).

- Excellent organizational skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

- Comfortable working independently and as part of a cross-functional team.

- Strong communication skills for interacting with designers, project managers, and clients.



DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Fast typing speed (80+ words per minute).

- Experience with GSuite (Docs, Sheets, Calendar).

- Familiarity with ClickUp or similar project management tools.

- Experience using Slack or similar team communication platforms.

- Proactive in identifying and solving front-end challenges.



COMPENSATION

$750-$1,000 USD per month



SCHEDULE

- 8 hour shift, Tuesday to Saturday, 7:00am to 4:00pm Manila Time.

- Minimal overtime during weekdays and weekends will be expected as part of salary



Dispenza is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, wordpressage, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.



If you’re a passionate front-end developer with a strong background in CSS and Bootstrap and are looking for a position where you can focus purely on design and styling, we want to hear from you!





HOW TO APPLY

Please fill out the following form in order for your application to be considered: 





Good luck!

title: Twitch VOD ? YouTube Editor (Creative, Long-Form Focus)
description:
I’m looking for a skilled and creative video editor to work directly with my Twitch VODs and turn them into high-quality YouTube videos.



Your core responsibility is to identify strong long-form moments directly from my Twitch streams (no files sent to you) and transform them into engaging YouTube videos—typically around 10 minutes, but longer if the content genuinely deserves it.



This is not a mechanical cutting job. I’m looking for someone who:

Has a strong sense of pacing and storytelling

Knows what actually works on YouTube

Can add their own editing flair while staying aligned with my brand



Our workflow is intentionally simple and low-friction:

You review Twitch VODs and identify a strong segment

You send me the idea / timestamps for confirmation

You edit the video + create the thumbnail

You send a draft for feedback

You apply revisions and deliver the final cut

I upload

Repeat 1–3 times per week consistently



The goal is for us to work in tandem with minimal resistance and mutual trust over time.



Responsibilities

Review Twitch VODs independently and identify YouTube-worthy segments

Edit long-form YouTube videos (?10 minutes, sometimes longer)

Create compelling YouTube thumbnails (CTR matters)

Apply your own creative editing style while respecting feedback

Communicate clearly and iterate efficiently



Requirements

Proven experience editing YouTube videos (long-form, not just shorts)

Strong understanding of pacing, retention, and storytelling

Ability to work independently without hand-holding

Comfortable sourcing content directly from Twitch VODs

Familiar with YouTube thumbnails and title-driven thinking

Good English comprehension (spoken English not required)



Hours

8 hours per day

Long-term role if the fit is strong



Salary

$2-4 per hour, depending on experience and quality

Paid monthly

Opportunity for raises and increased output over time



To Apply

Please include:

A short intro about you

Links to YouTube videos you’ve edited (long-form preferred)

A brief explanation of how you approach finding good moments in long streams



If you’re someone who enjoys thinking creatively, spotting great moments, and building something long-term—not just cutting clips—this role will suit you well.

title: Google Ads Specialist
description:

successfully, adopt it widely across their organization, ensure they continuously gain business

value As a Customer Success Coordinator (CSC), you'll partner closely with our Customer Success

successfully, adopt it widely across their organization, ensure they continuously gain business

Customer Marketing teams.

and marketing questions

 and online presentations

growth

accomplishments

on a day-to-day basis

Meet)

title: QA Specialist
description:
JOB SUMMARY:

The QAS will review functional requirements and user stories from the development and project management team. They will design test plans, write test cases, oversee test strategies and perform testing for assigned applications. The QAS will submit and verify defects, maintain documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of our software, Additionally they will analyze test results to certify existing functionality and integrations and recommend corrective action for failures. Testing will include functional and nonfunctional, integration, and regression.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 



Experience working in an Agile Software Development environment

Design functional and non-functional test cases that verify requirements and validate functionality across browsers and platforms.

Analyze user stories and technical requirements for validity, feasibility and create test routines.

Use methodical and repeatable processes to verify releases meet quality standards before launch

Detect, report, and track software defects

Contribute to troubleshooting and support of the software



QUALIFICATIONS:



Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science/Information Technology

Previous software testing experience is required

Excellent communicator - verbal and written skills required

Excellent analytical, debugging, problem-solving and root-cause analysis skills

Ability to meet tight deadlines working in an agile development environment.

title: Business Development Associate
description:
We're a Tampa-based painting and drywall company expanding our B2B client base. We need someone to help us build relationships with general contractors, restoration companies, and remodeling firms.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:

THIS ROLE INCLUDES:

- Collaborative work style (not a "work in silence" role)

COMPENSATION:

- $2,500/month base + performance-based commission

TO APPLY:

Record a 2-3 minute video answering:

2. You make 60 calls in a day and every single person either hangs up or says no. How do you show up the next morning?

3. Walk me through how you'd research and pitch one of our target companies if I gave you their name right now.



send your video to

title: LinkedIn Content Designer
description:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented LinkedIn Content Designer to join our team. In this role, you will create high-quality visual content tailored for LinkedIn, including infographics and carousels. This full-time position requires you to deliver polished designs with a focus on visual hierarchy, typography, and user engagement.

-Strong proficiency in Canva (Photoshop and Figma skills are a plus)

-Portfolio or design samples showcasing infographics, carousels, or similar social media content

-Experience creating designs for other social media platforms (e.g., Instagram,
)

title: Lead Qualification Assistant – Amazon Research
description:
Lead Qualification Assistant – Amazon Research (Remote)

Flexible Working Hours | Remote 



About Us:

The Amazon Whisperer is a fast-growing eCommerce marketing agency helping consumer brands scale profitably on Amazon and other marketplaces. We work with a large volume of brands and rely on clean, accurate data to identify high-potential opportunities.



We’re looking for a detail-oriented Lead Qualification Assistant to help us manually qualify a large list of Amazon seller leads. This is a straightforward, repeatable task and is ideal for someone who is comfortable with spreadsheets, basic research, and working independently.



The Role:

This role is focused entirely on manual lead qualification using a provided spreadsheet and clear instructions.

You will be working through tens of thousands of leads, one by one, and gathering basic data to help us determine whether a brand is worth contacting.

This is not a strategic role and does not require advanced Amazon knowledge — just accuracy, consistency, and reliability.



What You’ll Be Doing:

Open a provided link to a brand’s Amazon store or product listing

Confirm the brand has active products listed on Amazon

Open Helium 10 and:

Check the estimated monthly revenue of products on the first page

Enter required data into a spreadsheet:

Monthly revenue estimate

Confirmation of active products

Any basic notes (if applicable)

Move on to the next lead and repeat the process

Clear SOPs and examples will be provided.





Requirements:

Comfortable working with Google Sheets

Basic familiarity with Amazon product listings

Willingness to follow a repetitive, process-driven task

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Reliable internet connection

Ability to work independently without constant supervision

Prior experience with Helium 10 is a plus (but not required — guide will be provided)





Pay & Hours:

Flexible hours

Long-term work available due to the large volume of leads

Performance-based continuation (consistent accuracy = ongoing work)



Who This Role Is Best For: 

Entry-level virtual assistants

Anyone looking for simple, stable, process-based work

Detail-oriented individuals who prefer clear instructions and minimal ambiguity

Those comfortable doing repetitive tasks efficiently





How to Apply (Important):

To apply, please respond with all of the following:

Your resume (PDF or Google Drive link)

Your
 address where we can contact you

Typing test result (screenshot or link) showing:

At least 40 WPM

High accuracy

 (You may use sites like 
 or 
)





Applications missing any of the above will not be reviewed.

title: Part-Time Social Media Manager Wanted
description:
We’re looking for a skilled Part-Time Social Media Manager to join our team and help grow our brand’s online presence. If you have a proven track record in managing social media accounts, creating engaging content, and driving measurable results, we want to hear from you!



Skills & Requirements:



- Proven experience managing social media platforms (Instagram,
, LinkedIn,
, TikTok, etc.)

- Expertise in Canva for designing eye-catching visuals and social media posts

- Strong understanding of organic growth strategies

- Ability to analyze and report on social media metrics

- Experience in creating content calendars and scheduling posts

- Excellent copywriting skills tailored to different audiences and platforms

- Familiarity with social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer, Later)

- Understanding of paid social campaigns is a plus but not mandatory



What We Need From You:



Please submit a portfolio including case studies for at least 3 projects where you have:



1. Grown followers organically: Show us specific numbers and percentages that demonstrate how you increased follower count without paid ads.

2. Improved or drove engagement: Provide data on likes, comments, shares, saves, or other relevant engagement metrics before and after your work.

3. Contributed to conversions: Share examples where your social media efforts led to measurable actions such as signups, lead generation, purchases, or other conversion goals.



Make sure to quantify your results clearly (e.g., “Increased Instagram followers by 35% over 6 months,” “Boosted post engagement rate from 2% to 7%,” “Generated 200+ leads through targeted social campaigns”).



Bonus:



Along with your portfolio, please describe:



- Your favorite tools for social media management and content creation

- How you are currently using AI tools to create content more efficiently and effectively





If this sounds like a fit for you, please apply with your portfolio and answers to the questions above. We’re excited to see how you can help us grow!





Note: Only candidates who provide detailed case studies with quantifiable results will be considered.

Proven ability to create ads for DTC e-commerce / performance marketing 
, TikTok, Instagram)

title: Video Editor at She Reigns Creative
description:
Are you a driven Video Editor who wants to play a pivotal role in a boutique marketing agency? Do you aspire to shape and influence the visual narrative of content while supporting women-owned businesses in scaling their impact?



As a Video Editor at She Reigns Creative, you'll collaborate on a variety of exciting video projects—from short-form content and social media clips to long-form training series and client campaigns. You’ll help bring ideas to life visually, elevating our production standards and making our clients' stories shine.



If you’re passionate about crafting compelling content, possess excellent technical and storytelling instincts, and thrive in a fast-paced, remote environment, we want to hear from you.

About Us



She Reigns Creative is a boutique marketing agency that partners with women entrepreneurs and mission-driven brands. Our globally distributed, all-remote team shares a deep commitment to excellence, collaboration, and heart-led strategy.



Our core values—visionary thinking, creativity, impeccable communication, trust & accountability, passion, and empathy—are at the foundation of everything we create.

About the Role



We’re looking for a detail-oriented, strategic Video Editor who can not only execute edits with precision—but also think like a marketer. You'll be responsible for shaping stories that connect, convert, and inspire.

Responsibilities



Edit raw video footage into polished deliverables that align with brand tone and strategic goals



Add B-roll, music, transitions, captions, and branding elements to bring content to life



Cut long-form content into short-form, value-packed clips for reels, ads, and teasers



Ensure correct aspect ratios, sizing, and optimization for multiple social platforms



Use strong storytelling instincts to choose impactful footage and create visual flow



Balance and mix audio, apply sound effects, and select music that enhances emotional tone



Understand each client’s unique voice so your edits aren’t just “clean”—they’re effective



Collaborate with internal tea
mbers to meet deadlines and raise the creative bar



Maintain consistency with brand guidelines while adapting edits for varied formats



Stay updated on the latest trends in video, social content, and digital storytelling



Qualifications



2–3 years of experience editing for social, digital, or commercial video content



Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or equivalent editing software



Strong command of English—able to interpret tone, messaging, and intent through visuals



Fast, efficient editing workflow with sharp attention to detail and pacing



Available during US Eastern business hours (9AM–5PM EST) for Slack communication and collaboration



Proactive mindset with the ability to suggest improvements in structure, clarity, and engagement



Solid grasp of sound mixing, music selection, and emotional storytelling through audio



Self-starter attitude—you care about the why, not just the how, of each edit



Access to a professional editing setup (Mac or PC with ample RAM, storage, and capability to handle complex projects)



Committed to staying current with editing tools, social media trends, and engagement best practices



Work Hours & Communication



Full-time, remote position



Must be available M–F, 9AM–5PM US Eastern Time



Communication is managed via Slack and project tools



Active participation in tea
etings and creative discussions is expected



To Apply:

Please submit your resume, a link to your portfolio, and include the phrase “Live Long and Prosper” somewhere in your application to show you read this all the way through.

title: Entry Level Technical VA- No Experience Needed
description:
A thriving marketing agency is looking to add one more member to our amazing staff! We are looking for a brilliant, organized individual who has the aptitude to perform logic-based and detail-oriented tasks at a reasonable pace, understands the value of hard work, and wants to grow with the company.



Writing ability and knowledge of basic web development and Schema Markup for SEO is a big plus. You do not need any kind of experience - we will train. We look for brains, ambition, and work ethic – not experience. But experience is always great :). Please watch this video before applying (fix the link to watch the video. link: www.loom. com/share/706dc17d459e435b9b5ef748eb3670f8 )



Benefits include:

4-day workweek!

3 weeks paid leave per year

13th month pay

Performance-based Equipment Bonus

2 raises a year (sometimes more based on performance)

Paid 105 days maternity leave (eligible only if you've been with the company for at least 1 year)

Paid 3 weeks paternity leave (eligible only if you've been with the company for at least 1 year)

A respectful and welcoming work environment

A variety of assignments



Starting full-time salary is $130 per week (40 hours/week). Work hours would be 10 hours per day, Monday through Thursday. Shift time may vary depending on job assignment upon hiring with the range being 3 PM to 1 AM or 5 PM to 3 AM PH Time)



Please do not apply for the position if you are not comfortable with this salary, or if you have other commitments, such as being a student or having another job. After 3 months, you'll be eligible for up to 10 hours of paid overtime per week at 1.5x the regular rate, so if you want to earn more, you do not need to go outside of the company.



Please include the word "unicorn" in the title of your application. Also, before sending your application, please answer this questionnaire (https ://forms. gle/AU2BM4dWacedPq9v7). Send a screenshot of confirmation that you have finished the questionnaire.



Please be aware that there will be a trial interview following the initial interview process.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
Company: Book Werkz

 Location: Remote

 Schedule & Availability:

Monday–Wednesday: 9:00 AM–5:00 PM CST

Thursday–Friday: 9:00 AM–5:00 PM CST if QuickBooks Online experience is present

Compensation: Starting at $8.50/hour 



About Book Werkz

Book Werkz is a boutique bookkeeping and financial services firm that partners with small businesses to deliver reliable, accurate, and proactive financial clarity. We work with service-based businesses across multiple industries and pride ourselves on precision, communication, and treating each client’s business as if it were our own.

Our team operates with a high standard of accountability, clear processes, and open communication. We value tea
mbers who are dependable, detail-oriented, and confident in their craft.



Position Overview

The Payroll Specialist is responsible for executing accurate, timely payroll processing across multiple client accounts and supporting payroll-related compliance and reporting. This role is highly execution-focused and requires proven payroll experience across multiple platforms.

This is not a training or entry-level role. Candidates must already be confident running payroll independently and managing multiple payroll schedules with minimal oversight.

The Payroll Specialist will work closely with the CEO and bookkeeping team to ensure payroll is processed accurately, on time, and in alignment with Book Werkz standards.



Purpose of the Role

Ensure payroll is processed accurately and on time for all assigned clients

Maintain compliance and consistency across payroll platforms

Reduce payroll-related risk, rework, and client escalations

Support continuity through documentation and cross-training readiness



Key Responsibilities

Process payroll accurately and on schedule for multiple client accounts

Manage payroll platforms including iSolved, ADP, Paylocity, and Gusto

Review payroll data for accuracy, including wages, deductions, benefits, and taxes

Handle payroll adjustments, corrections, and off-cycle payrolls as needed

Communicate directly with internal tea
mbers regarding payroll deadlines and requirements

Respond to payroll-related client inquiries in a professional and timely manner

Maintain payroll documentation and ensure records are complete and up to date

Support payroll audits, reconciliations, and compliance requests

Follow documented payroll workflows and contribute to ongoing process documentation

Participate in cross-training to ensure payroll continuity and coverage



Collaboration & Communication

You will collaborate with:

CEO (Hillary): For clarification, escalation, and alignment on payroll processes

Bookkeeping Team: To coordinate payroll data, deadlines, and client needs

Clients (as needed): For payroll-related questions, confirmations, or missing information

Communication tools include Slack, Canopy, and
. Clear, proactive communication is essential.



Expectations

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Strong time management and ability to meet strict payroll deadlines

Clear and professional written communication

Comfort managing payroll for multiple clients simultaneously

Ability to follow established processes consistently

Willingness to document workflows and flag discrepancies proactively



Required Experience & Skills

Proven, hands-on payroll experience (not theoretical or assisted only)

Demonstrated experience using iSolved, ADP, Paylocity, and Gusto

Ability to manage payroll across multiple clients and schedules

Understanding of payroll compliance and best practices

QuickBooks Online experience strongly preferred

Experience working in a remote, deadline-driven environment



Systems & Tools We Use

Payroll Platforms: iSolved, ADP, Paylocity, Gusto

QuickBooks Online

Canopy (task and workflow management)

Slack (team communication)

Gmail

Zoom

Loom



Important Notes

This is not a “train-on-the-job” position

Candidates must come with the required payroll experience

Accuracy, reliability, and consistency are non-negotiable



How to Apply

Please
 your resume and a brief summary of your payroll experience (including platforms used and number of clients supported) to

title: Business Development Representative
description:
Business Development Representative (BDR)

Remote | Full-Time | Long-Term



About Vantage Group

Vantage Group is a systems-driven facilities management and execution platform built for complex real estate portfolios. We partner with property owners and operators to centralize accountability, enforce standards, and eliminate operational chaos across both exterior and interior services.



We are scaling a business designed for scale, predictability, and long-term enterprise value. This is not a traditional services company, and this is not a transactional sales role.

We are looking for a Strategic Development Lead who can help us build a repeatable, owner-independent revenue engine.



The Role (Read Carefully)

The Business Development Representative (BDR) is responsible for building and owning a qualified book of business by identifying, engaging, qualifying, and advancing ICP-aligned buyers into signed relationships with Vantage Group.

This role goes far beyond lead generation.



You will:

Own outbound and early inbound conversations

Run structured discovery calls

Qualify and disqualify prospects

Advance deals through early stages

Protect leadership time by filtering out poor-fit opportunities

If you are looking for a task-based VA role, this is not the position.

If you enjoy strategic conversations, ownership, and accountability, keep reading.



What You Will Own

1. Pipeline & Book of Business Ownership

Build and manage your own pipeline of qualified prospects

Maintain a clean, accurate CRM

Ensure every opportunity has:

A confirmed decision-maker

Clear qualification status

Defined next steps

Provide weekly pipeline visibility and forecasting



2. ICP-Driven Prospecting & Outreach

Identify and target ICP-aligned property owners, operators, and developers

Build prospect lists by:

Geography

Asset type

Portfolio size

Execute structured outreach via:


LinkedIn

Other approved channels

Personalize outreach based on real operational context



3. Strategic Buyer Conversations (Not Pitching)

Lead first-touch and discovery conversations

Diagnose operational pain, risk exposure, and vendor challenges

Position Vantage as an accountability and execution partner — not a vendor

Ask intelligent, structured questions and listen carefully



4. Qualification & Disqualification Authority

Qualify prospects based on:

Authority

Portfolio complexity

Willingness to accept standards and enforcement

Disqualify prospects who are:

Price-only

Procurement-only

Low authority or misaligned

Protect margin and operational quality by saying “no” when necessary



5. Deal Advancement & Clean Handoffs

Advance qualified opportunities through early sales stages

Coordinate clean handoffs to internal teams with full context

Ensure no “blind handoffs” or misaligned expectations



6. Market Feedback & Intelligence

Capture common objections and buyer language

Track pricing reactions and competitive insights

Share feedback to refine messaging, targeting, and positioning

What You Will NOT Be Doing

You will not be a task-only VA

You will not blindly book meetings

You will not sell based on discounts

You will not operate outside defined systems

This is a thinking role, not a checklist role.



What We’re Looking For

Required:

Proven experience in:

Outbound sales

Business development

Strategic lead generation

Strong written and spoken English

Ability to run professional, structured conversations

Experience using CRMs consistently

High judgment, discipline, and attention to detail

Comfortable qualifying and disqualifying prospects



Strongly Preferred

Experience selling B2B services

Exposure to real estate, facilities management, construction, or operations

Understanding of complex or multi-location businesses

Experience working with decision-makers (VP, Director, Owner level)



How You’ll Be Measured

Quality and consistency of pipeline

ICP alignment of prospects

Conversion from conversation ? qualified opportunity

Clean CRM and reporting

Reduction of founder involvement in early sales

Repeating objections (signal of message clarity)



Compensation & Structure

Competitive monthly base (based on experience)

Performance-based incentives tied to qualified pipeline and closed business

Long-term opportunity to grow with the company as we scale

Stable, full-time, long-term role (not project-based)



Who Will Thrive Here

Self-directed professionals who like ownership

Strategic thinkers who enjoy diagnosing problems

People who want to build something real and scalable

Candidates who think like operators, not task executors



Who Should Not Apply

Appointment setters only

Script-readers with no judgment

Candidates who avoid accountability

Anyone looking for “just another VA role”



How to Apply

Please include:

A brief loom video of your experience in outbound sales or business development

The industries you’ve worked in

The types of buyers you’ve sold to

Your experience qualifying or disqualifying prospects

Applications without thoughtful responses will not be considered.

title: Full Charge Bookkeeper (Controller)
description:
The Role 



We are seeking a highly motivated Remote Controller to design, optimize, and manage accounting and operational systems for a real estate company engaged in property acquisition, rehabilitation, leasing, property management, and disposition. This role reports directly to the CEO and will work closely with leadership by providing accurate financial reporting and analysis to support operational and investment decision-making. The ideal candidate will have experience with multi-entity accounting, real estate construction or rehabilitation accounting, and single-family property management, and will be capable of building and maintaining institutional-quality accounting processes. 



The Controller will be responsible for full-cycle accounting and FP&A, including AP, AR, payroll, bank and credit card reconciliations, cash management, and monthly financial reporting. This role will oversee accounting for property acquisitions, capitalized rehab and turn costs, rental and property management operations, and property sales, optimize the current QuickBooks Online environment, and implement and manage a structured monthly close calendar to ensure timely and accurate reporting. The Controller will also support the evaluation and implementation of accounting and operational systems, including CRMs, and play a key role in planning and executing a future ERP migration from QuickBooks Online to Sage Intacct.



Key Responsibilities: 



• Enhance and provide accurate GAAP accounting records in Quickbooks Online: 



     • Cash/ Bank reconciliations 

     • Accounts Payable/ Expenses 

     • Treasury and Disbursements 

     • Accounts Receivable/ Revenue 

     • Payroll, Benefits and Compliance 

     • Construction and Margin Accounting 

     • Tax returns and Compliance 



• Record invoices and reconcile revenue per US GAAP 

• Process vendor invoices and schedule payments 

• Collect accounts receivable and apply cash receipts 

• Prepare monthly bank, credit card, and merchant account reconciliations 

• Process payroll, maintain accurate payroll records, tax filings, and benefits deductions 

• Monitor cash flow and prepare periodic cash position reports for management 

• Timely preparation of monthly financial statements and management reports 

• Support budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis to management 

• Liaise with external CPA or tax preparer for quarterly and year-end filings 

• Maintain accurate cost-of-goods-sold and margin reporting 

• Ensure compliance with GAAP standards and internal accounting controls 

• Identify opportunities to improve accounting processes and automate tasks 



Minimum Qualifications 



• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (preferred) 

• 5+ years of bookkeeping, controllership and systems experience 

• Strong proficiency in Quickbooks Online and Sage Intacct, including report building 

• Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management 

• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment 

• Ability to overlap with U.S. hours (Pacific Time)  



Key Attributes for Success 



• Communication skills in English, both verbal and written 

• Ability to prioritize, organize, manage time, and work independently to meet deadlines 

• Strong analytical, organizational, attention to detail, problem-solving, and leadership 

• High degree of professionalism and tact in dealing with internal and external partners 

• Must be thorough, thoughtful and able to perform well across various deliverables 



Perks and Benefits 



• U.S. CPA Exam Support: Reimbursement for prep and fees upon successful completion 

• Professional Development: Training, mentorship, ongoing exposure to U.S. clients 

• Career Growth: Clear career progression with performance-based evaluations 

• Global Exposure: Collaborate with U.S. based companies and/ or clients

description:

title: Shopify Website Setup Expert (Adhoc Project)
description:
-- Job Description --



I am looking for an experienced Shopify expert to assist with a once-off project to fully set up my Shopify website.



This role is ideal for someone who can take the lead, explain things clearly, and handle the technical setup from start to finish. I am new to Shopify and need someone who understands the full process and can guide me through what is required.



-- Scope of Work --



The successful candidate will assist with:



- Full Shopify store setup

- Theme selection and customization

- Store structure (pages, navigation, collections)

- Product setup (templates, pricing structure, variants – details provided by me)

- Payment gateway setup

- Shipping settings (basic configuration)

- Essential apps installation and setup

- Basic SEO setup (titles, descriptions, URLs)

- Store testing and launch readiness

- Clear handover and explanation of how to manage the store after setup



This is a one-time project, not ongoing work (unless mutually agreed later).



-- Requirements --



- Proven experience setting up Shopify stores

- Strong understanding of Shopify best practices

- Ability to work independently and recommend solutions

- Good communication skills (English)

- Patient and clear when explaining processes to beginners

- Portfolio or examples of Shopify stores you’ve built



-- Project Type --



- One-off / Fixed project

- Estimated duration: To be discussed

- Start: As soon as possible



-- To Apply, Please Include --



- Brief overview of your Shopify experience

- Links to Shopify stores you’ve worked on

- Your proposed price for a complete Shopify setup

- Estimated time required to complete the project

- Confirmation that this is a once-off project you can fully handle

description:

title: Customer Service (Dispatcher)
description:
We are seeking a proactive, customer-focused Dispatcher to support day-to-day transportation operations. This role is responsible for managing inbound and outbound calls, coordinating drivers, and ensuring smooth, efficient service for customers in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate is highly responsive, communicates clearly in English with minimal accent, and is comfortable multitasking under pressure while prioritizing customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

• Handle inbound and outbound customer calls professionally and efficiently

• Dispatch drivers and manage ride assignments in real time

• Resolve customer inquiries, issues, and last-minute changes calmly and proactively

• Monitor active rides and anticipate potential delays or problems

• Support operational continuity during both busy and slow periods

• Able to resolve complex issues independently.

• Able to understand maps quickly



Required Skills & Qualifications

• Strong spoken English with clear pronunciation and minimal accent

• Proven experience in dispatching, call handling, or customer service (transportation preferred)

• Strong sense of ownership, reliability, and accountability

• Customer-first mindset with calm, professional phone etiquette

Preferred Attributes

• Experience working with U.S.-based customers

• Familiarity with transportation, logistics, or car service operations

• Ability to stay engaged and productive during slower periods

• Flexible and responsive to changing priorities
