title: Business Development Specialist – U.S. Real Estate Brokerages (Outbound)
description:
We are hiring a confident, professional outbound sales specialist to speak directly with residential real estate brokerage owners and managing brokers across the United States.



This is NOT a call center or telemarketing job.



You will be having real business conversations with company owners and decision-makers, introducing our technology platform and booking qualified appointments for our solutions team.



You must sound clear, natural, and professional in English with little to no accent. You should be comfortable speaking with executives and business owners.



If you can build trust quickly, ask smart questions, and guide conversations naturally, you will thrive in this role.



About Us



We are Voxvy, a U.S.-based technology company.



We provide AI-powered systems that help real estate brokerages capture every missed call, website lead, and message automatically — increasing appointments, reviews, and revenue without hiring more staff.



We work directly with brokerage owners and managing brokers.



This is a professional B2B sale, not consumer calling.



What You’ll Do



• Call brokerage owners and managing brokers

• Start natural, professional conversations

• Briefly explain our system (training + scripts provided)

• Qualify interest and needs

• Book 15-minute demo appointments

• Follow up with prospects

• Update CRM notes



Primary goal: booked, qualified appointments that show up.



This is consultative, not pushy selling.



Who We’re Looking For



• Excellent spoken English (clear and neutral accent required)

• Confident speaking with U.S. business owners

• Experience in B2B sales, appointment setting, or closing

• Comfortable handling objections calmly

• Professional tone (not “salesy” or aggressive)

• Reliable internet and quiet workspace

• Self-motivated and organized



Ideal Background (bonus but not required)



• Experience calling U.S. real estate agents or brokerages

• SaaS or software sales

• Appointment setting for high-ticket services

• Familiar with CRM systems or GoHighLevel



Compensation



• Hourly base pay

• Bonus per qualified appointment

• Bonus per completed demo

• Additional commission on closed deals



High performers can earn significantly above base.



Schedule



U.S. business hours (Monday–Friday)



Why This Role Is Different



You are not reading scripts or making spam calls.



You will be speaking directly with business owners about real operational problems and booking meaningful conversations.



This is a professional sales role with growth potential.



How to Apply



Please include:



A 30–60 second voice recording introducing yourself



Your sales or calling experience



Your available U.S. working hours



Why you would be comfortable speaking with brokerage owners



Applications without an audio sample will not be reviewed.

title: Video Editor (Part-Time, Long-Term Project)
description:
Responsibilities:

Edit short-form videos (30–90s) with strong visual, text, and sound hooks that grab attention within the first 3 seconds.

Craft cinematic, story-driven edits that evoke emotion and curiosity — every frame should feel intentional.

Sync captions perfectly with visuals using clean, handwritten-style fonts that enhance storytelling.

Add dynamic transitions (zoom-ins, cinematic cuts, motion effects) and tasteful sound design layers (ambience, whoosh, subtle SFX).

Maintain a 1-day turnaround time per video — speed and quality must coexist.

Be open to iterations and feedback, working directly with me to refine every detail quickly.



Requirements:

Proven experience editing cinematic, emotional, viral-style videos (portfolio required).

Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.

Exceptional sense of pacing, rhythm, and storytelling flow — every second should matter.

Able to work under tight timelines and deliver consistently without compromising quality.

Fast communication — replies within hours, not days.

Bonus: Familiarity with content trends, visual hooks, and audience retention strategies on TikTok, IG Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



Before Applying:



Please share:

Your portfolio or showreel (ideally storytelling / viral-style edits).

Your turnaround time (confirm you can deliver within 24 hours per video).

Your rate per video or hourly rate.

A short note on why you’re confident you can match or exceed Gabe Chia’s storytelling style.



Model:


==

title: Virtual Administrator and Systems Development Coordinator
description:
Reorient is a online contemplative Christian community and mentoring ecosystem that helps people awaken to their True Self in Divine Love. Through Awaken Circles, the Reorient Collective on Mighty Network, Sourced Life mentoring, online book cohorts, retreats, and weekly online practice, we support deep spiritual transformation and creative participation in the world.



Reports to: A. Dean Stelow - Reorient Founder

?Location: Remote



Administrative Anchor

Reorient is in need of a administrative partner to help provide its founder space and time to restructure for growth potential. 



Maintain founder’s schedule and
s 

Maintain Reorient’s various outfacing calendars

Organize content and oversee communications for Reorient programs and events

Coordinating with founder, schedule and support leadership meetings, planning processes and development rhythms



Wise Systems Builder and Tech Support

Offer a practical, tech savvy, calming presence that simplifies processes and creates smooth, efficient workflows and environments for Dean, the team, and the community.



Design and maintain simple, healthy, efficient systems for…



Leadership meetings and volunteer connections

Communications and on-going member participation and community engagement

Content development flows and organization

Event/Program registration and reminders

New member onboarding and follow up

Outreach and basic marketing and social media



Organize and update
 lists.



Integrate and maintain our Apps tools and platforms:

Current Apps and Platforms: WIX, WordPress, Mighty Networks, Donorbox, Calendly, Google Workspace, KIT



We are looking for someone who not only handles tasks effectively but also shares in the spiritual heart of our work: Tuned in for what work is most needed now and where we are being inviting and needing to grow. We need you to be organized, clear yet warm in your communication and able to manage your time well. Integrity, discretion, and confidentiality, are held in the high regard. Reorient is a beautiful and sacred community and we are looking for a partner to help us nurture growth and expansion in a respectful manner. Preference will be given to candidates with an active contemplative practice and experience in spiritual community.

title: PPC Specialist
description:
KickCharge is seeking a full-time, experienced Pay Per Click Specialist to join a dynamic paid search team.



As a KickCharge PPC Specialist, you will drive traffic and ROI via paid client acquisition tactics for our clients. The candidate will regularly optimize paid search efforts to help achieve department and company goals. This position will be responsible for keyword research planning, campaign/bid management, copywriting, landing page optimization, and ROI tracking plus analysis.



Responsibilities Include:

Execute and improve all paid search tactics through hands-on day to day optimizations across paid channels (Google and Bing)

Strategize with PPC team

Perform ongoing keyword expansion including identification and implementation of keyword opportunities

Increase CTR with compelling ad copy enhancements and creation

Optimize landing pages for maximum conversions and implement re-marketing strategies

Management of ad expenditures with daily reporting, performance analysis, and bid optimization techniques

Collect and analyze data to identify trends and insights to achieve maximum ROI in paid search campaigns

Keep up-to-date with PPC best practices, keyword research tools, and industry plus competitor research

Providing detailed reports of progress



Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Advertising, Marketing, Communications, Business, or related fields

Google Analytics and Google Adwords Certified

Must have at least two years of experience in digital marketing and PPC.

Excellent understanding of contemporary digital marketing principles, strategies, and best practices

Synergized understanding of other forms of digital marketing, including content marketing, SEO, conversion optimization, landing page optimization, paid marketing, re-targeting, etc.

Proven experience managing PPC campaigns across Google and Bing.

Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition

In-depth experience with website analytics tools Including Google Analytics, Optmyzer, etc.

Strong english & communication skills a must.



About Us:

What does your day look like?

Closely monitoring campaign metrics to ensure the best performance. CPAs, CTR, Impression Shares, Conversions.

Analyzing campaigns to see how they are performing, and make adjustments based on data to improve results.

Auditing accounts in search of potential improvements.

Communicating with teaUpgrade to see actual infombers to ensure results and expectations are being met.

Crafting unique and engaging ad copy.

Effective keyword research and planning.

Overall campaign adjustments and optimization.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
KickCharge is seeking a full-time, experienced SEO Specialist to join a dynamic SEO team.



As a KickCharge SEO Specialist, you will drive traffic and ROI via organic search ranking tactics for our clients. The candidate will be a master at advanced SEO techniques, ranging from competitors' backlinks assessments, outreach, detailed analysis in tools like Ahrefs, suggesting on-page changes based on Ahrefs, and even assisting with website migration strategies to enhance SEO. This position requires the ability to multitask, work with a team, and above all, to drive results for our clients.



Responsibilities Include:

•Regularly monitor organic SERP traction by using tools like Google Analytics, Ahrefs, SEMRush and BrightLocal

•Regularly monitor competitor link-building strategies

•Regularly monitor Google Business Profile rankings

•Suggest on-page edits to improve SEO strength

•Support our SEO Citation Building Team

•Support our Web team when preparing website migrations

•Suggest optimization of web pages for maximum ranking and implement 

•Collect and analyze data to identify trends and insights to achieve maximum ROI in organic search campaigns

•Keep up-to-date with SEO best practices, keyword research tools, and industry-plus competitor research



Requirements:

•Bachelor's degree in Advertising, Marketing, Communications, Business, or related fields

•Google Analytics Certified A Plus

•In-depth experience with Ahrefs

•Must be able to speak English fluently in written and verbal form.

•Must have at least two years of experience in digital marketing and SEO.

•Excellent understanding of contemporary digital marketing principles, strategies, and best practices

•Synergized understanding of other forms of digital marketing, including content marketing, PPC, conversion optimization, landing page optimization, paid marketing, re-targeting, etc.

•Proven experience managing SEO campaigns across Google and Bing.

•Technical SEO skills a plus. 

•Google Business Profile experience a plus.

•Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition



About Us:

What does your day look like?

•Closely monitoring campaign metrics to ensure the best performance.

•Analyzing SEO strategies to see how they are performing, and make adjustments based on data to improve results.

•Auditing accounts in search of potential improvements.

•Communicating with tea
mbers to ensure results and expectations are being met.

•Effective backlink research and planning.

•Overall campaign adjustments and optimization.



To Apply:

Please send a cover letter and CV/Résumé outlining your experience and certifications, along with a video of YOU explaining your SEO philosophy, and why you'd made a great fit to the team.

title: Travel Planner
description:
We are a bespoke tour operator who designs custom itineraries for clients traveling to Scotland.



We are looking for a Travel Planner with at least 2 years experience working in a similar inbound tour operator and has previously planned custom itineraries and been involved in booking vendors.



Please write briefly in 3 sentences the the name of the tour operator you previously worked for, what responsibilities you had and which Tour Planning Software you have experience with.



You will work within our Tour Planning Software to create itineraries for clients and book vendors for the tours.



GDS experience is a plus but not essential.

title: Real Estate - Acquisition Manager
description:
Job Title: Acquisition Manager Manager

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time – 48 Hours per week

Department: Sales & Customer Experience

Salary: $1,500 +2% commission on deal size

________________________________________

About Us

At Solution Based Homebuyers, we specialize in identifying, acquiring, and managing prime real estate properties. As a forward-thinking and innovative firm, we are dedicated to delivering top-tier services for our clients and partners. We are currently seeking a highly motivated Real Estate Sales Acquisition Specialist to join our team and help us expand our portfolio by identifying new investment opportunities and facilitating property acquisitions.

Job Summary

We are seeking a strategic and customer-focused Acquisition Manager – Customer Relations to lead initiatives that drive customer acquisition while enhancing engagement and satisfaction. This role bridges marketing, sales, and customer success, making sure our first impression is impactful and lasting.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

• Develop and implement customer acquisition strategies that align with company goals.

• Lead and optimize customer onboarding and engagement programs to ensure seamless transitions.

• Build and maintain strong relationships with prospective and new clients to boost retention and satisfaction.

• Analyze data and customer feedback to continuously refine acquisition and communication strategies.

• Collaborate with marketing, sales, and customer support teams to ensure alignment and synergy.

• Manage CRM tools to track customer interactions and lifecycle stages.

• Report on KPIs and make recommendations for improvement based on insights.

• Represent the voice of the customer in strategic planning meetings.



________________________________________

Qualifications



- Proven experience in real estate acquisitions, with a strong track record of successful property purchases.

- Solid understanding of real estate market analysis, investment principles, and property valuation.

- Exceptional negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.

- Self-motivated, results-driven, and comfortable working independently.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

- Proficiency with real estate CRM systems and MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, etc.).



Why Join Us

• Opportunity to shape a core business function in a dynamic, growing company.

• Collaborative and inclusive team culture.

• Professional development and growth opportunities.

• [Health benefits, flexible work arrangements, bonus structures, etc.]

________________________________________

Apply Now

If you’re passionate about connecting with customers and driving meaningful growth, we want to hear from you. Submit your resume and Contact us through our whatsapp number 
..

title: Real Estate Disposition Manager! Hiring!
description:
Job Title: Real Estate Disposition Manager

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time | $1500/month + 1% commission on deal size

Start Date: ASAP



**About Us**

We are a fast-growing real estate investment company specializing in residential acquisitions and wholesale real estate. Our team is driven, collaborative, and performance-focused, and we’re seeking a proven **Real Estate Disposition Manager** to lead and scale our property disposition process.



**Job Summary**

As our Disposition Manager, you will be responsible for managing the sale of acquired investment properties to our network of buyers, including fix-and-flippers, landlords, and institutional investors. This is a critical role that directly impacts revenue and requires a confident closer who thrives in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.



**Key Responsibilities**

* Manage the entire disposition process from listing to closing

* Build and maintain strong relationships with a network of qualified buyers

* Price and position properties strategically based on market data and buyer profiles

* Create and distribute compelling marketing materials for properties

* Negotiate sales terms to maximize profitability

* Coordinate with escrow/title companies to ensure a smooth closing process

* Maintain a buyer CRM and track communications and deal status

* Provide regular sales performance updates to leadership



**Required Qualifications**

* Proven and solid experience (1+ years) as a Disposition Manager or in a similar role within the real estate investment industry

* A track record of closing deals and maximizing assignment fees

* Strong knowledge of residential real estate markets, especially in wholesaling and investment properties

* Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills

* Self-starter with the ability to work independently and hit performance targets

* Proficient with CRM systems (e.g., InvestorFuse, Podio, or similar)

* Understanding of real estate contracts, title/escrow process, and compliance



**Preferred Qualifications**

* Existing buyers network a strong plus

* Experience working in a fast-paced, startup-like environment

* Real Estate License (preferred but not required)

* Willing to work some hours on weekends



**Compensation**

* $1500/month + 1% commission on deal size

* Opportunity for advancement in a growing company



**How to Apply**

Submit your resume link and a brief cover letter outlining your disposition experience and notable deals you've closed.



Take the next step in your real estate career. If you're a proven closer ready to lead a high-volume deal pipeline—we want to hear from you!

title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
Position Overview: 



As the Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth and efficient functioning of the executive office. Your primary responsibility will be to provide comprehensive administrative support to the CEO, managing their schedule, and coordinating various tasks to enhance productivity. Your ability to maintain confidentiality, exercise sound judgment, and proactively handle administrative duties will contribute to the overall effectiveness of the CEO's office. 



 

Pay Range: $7 per hour with a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 

About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 

Objectives: 

• Manage and organize the CEO's daily schedule, including meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.

• Act as a gatekeeper, screening and prioritizing communications to the CEO.

• Coordinate and facilitate communication between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.

• Anticipate the CEO's needs and proactively handle tasks to ensure optimal time management.

• Coordinate special projects and initiatives as assigned by the CEO.



 

Competencies: 

• Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills, with keen attention to detail.

• Strong written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion in handling sensitive information.

• Proficient in using Microsoft Office and Google Suites.

• Familiarity with scheduling software; experience with additional productivity tools is an advantage.

• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels.

• Proactive problem solver and resourceful thinker.



 

Equipment Requirements:  

• Must own a reliable computer or laptop capable of handling administrative tasks efficiently.

• Must own and actively use an iPhone and/or MacBook or Mac computer for efficient communication and task management.

• High-speed internet connection to support video calls, cloud-based collaboration, and remote work.



 

Physical Requirements: 

• Extended periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

 

Benefits: 

• Growth opportunities in a well-established company.

• Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.

• Opportunity for advancement within the company.

• A supportive and collaborative work environment.

• Company-observed paid United States holidays (full time).

• Paid vacation.





How to Apply: 



If you are ready to join Power Plus Systems, LLC, a well-established residential electrical contractor that values its tea
mbers and offers excellent benefits, please submit your application through the link below. 




/internationalcareers



Power Plus Systems, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply. 



Join us at Power Plus Systems, LLC, and be part of our continued success as we embark on the next 20 years of excellence in residential electrical contracting!

title: Scheduling Assistant II
description:
Position Overview: 



The Scheduling Assistant is responsible for managing and coordinating various administrative tasks, including handling permits, warranties, inspections, and other ad hoc duties to support the Resource Department. This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. 



 



Pay Range: $7 per hour with a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 



About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 



Objectives: 



Ensure all permits, inspections, and warranties are scheduled and processed promptly, adhering to departmental timelines and requirements. 



Maintain accurate records of permits, inspections, and warranty-related activities to ensure compliance with local regulations and industry standards. 



Provide administrative support to the Resource and Admin Operations Department by handling various ad hoc tasks and projects as needed. 



Facilitate clear and efficient communication between internal teams, clients, and external partners to enhance project coordination and client satisfaction. 



 



Competencies: 



Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment. 



High attention to detail to ensure accuracy and thoroughness in handling permits, documentation, and administrative tasks. 



Ability to multitask and juggle various responsibilities while maintaining a high standard of work. 



Excellent written and verbal communication skills to interact effectively with tea
mbers, clients, and external agencies. 



Problem-solving skills to identify issues and develop practical solutions to scheduling and administrative challenges. 



Proficiency in using scheduling software, Microsoft Office Suite, and other relevant tools to manage administrative tasks efficiently. 



Customer service orientation to provide excellent service to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring a positive experience and high level of satisfaction.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Company Overview

Join our SaaS Customer Engagement Platform company as a Remote DevOps Engineer. We are looking for a highly motivated, self-starting candidate who is ready to take ownership of our infrastructure and security compliance initiatives.



Role Description

As a DevOps Engineer, you'll own the full lifecycle of our cloud infrastructure and deployment systems. You'll build CI/CD pipelines, manage Azure resources, drive security certification initiatives, and work with our team to optimize costs. We're looking for someone with genuine drive and curiosity who digs into problems, learns quickly, and keeps pushing forward. You don't need to know everything on day one, but you need the hunger to master it.



Key Responsibilities



Infrastructure & Deployment

- Architect, develop, deploy, and evolve CI/CD systems for our cloud applications

- Write application deployment automation using industry-standard tools like Jenkins

- Deploy and manage Azure services including App Services, SQL Database, and Virtual Machines

- Monitor system performance and respond to monitoring alerts

- Provide systems support and perform emergency deployments outside standard hours when needed



Security Certifications & Compliance

- Lead the initiative to achieve and maintain key security certifications including ISO 27001 and FedRAMP

- Develop a strategic roadmap for pursuing multiple certifications, identifying overlaps and dependencies

- Execute certification initiatives incrementally, building knowledge and compliance over time

- Write comprehensive documentation for security certification applications and audits

- Implement and maintain security best practices across infrastructure



Data & Database Management

- Demonstrate strong understanding of database systems including MongoDB and SQL databases

- Implement and manage backup strategies and disaster recovery procedures

- Apply security best practices in data storage, access, and management



Cost Optimization

- Identify and recommend Azure cost-saving opportunities and optimization techniques

- Collaborate with development teams to determine cost-efficient architectural solutions

- Provide guidance on resource utilization and cloud spending optimization



User & System Administration

- Manage Active Directory administration including adding users, setting up new employees and contractors

- Provide configuration support and troubleshooting for employees and contractors as needed



What We're Looking For

- Genuine drive to learn and take on complex challenges

- Self-directed problem solver who stays engaged with difficult problems

- Strong communication and documentation skills

- Ability to work independently

- Willingness to respond to emergencies outside standard hours



Foundational Experience (You'll grow from here)

- Hands-on experience with CI/CD concepts and tools like Jenkins, Azure DevOps, or GitHub Actions

- Working knowledge of Azure cloud platform

- Understanding of GitHub for version control and collaboration

- Experience with monitoring and observability tools (Pingdom, DataDog, New Relic, or similar)

- Basic familiarity with databases and scripting/automation concepts

- Willingness to perform deployment tasks during off-hours in emergency situations



 Required for Application

- Provide a link to your resume/CV

- Include a cover letter with a brief summary of your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position

- Use the subject line: 'DevOps - [Your Name]'

title: Social Media Profiles & Campaign Manager
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Social Media Profiles & Campaign Manager with 5+ years managing brand social channels end-to-end and running performance-focused paid social. 

You’ll own our social presence across platforms and drive growth through smart, creative, and data-backed campaigns, especially in consumer goods.



Own and optimize brand profiles across Instagram, TikTok,
, YouTube, Pinterest, X/Threads (as relevant).



Build and manage a content calendar aligned to launches, promos, seasonal 
nts, and brand storytelling.



Brief, coordinate, and QA creative (in-house or creators): scripts, hooks, captions, thumbnails, UGC.



Lead community management: engagement, moderation, escalation, and brand voice consistency.



Track performance and translate insights into actionable improvements (what to double down on / cut).



Plan, launch, and optimize paid campaigns on Meta Ads Manager and TikTok Ads Manager (bonus: Snapchat, Pinterest, YouTube, Amazon DSP).

5+ years in social media management + campaign execution.



Proven experience with consumer goods (CPG, beauty, wellness, home, food/bev, fashion, etc.).



Hands-on expertise running paid ads on Meta and TikTok (from setup to optimization).



Strong creative instincts: understands hooks, formats, trends, and what performs.



Comfortable with data: reporting, experimentation, and performance optimization.



Excellent writing and brand voice control (captions, comments, concise briefs).



Experience with creator whitelisting, Spark Ads, affiliate programs.



/SMS collaboration and broader growth marketing knowledge.



Familiarity with tools like GA4, Shopify, Triple Whale/Northbeam, Later/Sprout/Hootsuite, Canva/Adobe.

title: Job Opportunity – Experienced Shopify Web Developer
description:
Hi there,



I hope you’re doing well. I’m reaching out from JitteryGit, a fast-growing company specializing in licensed toy products and eCommerce development. We’re currently looking for a professional Shopify Web Developer to join our team and help us build, optimize, and scale our online stores.



Position: Shopify Web Developer

Location: [Remote / On-site / Hybrid]

Type: Full-time / Contract



Key Responsibilities:

- Design, develop, and maintain responsive Shopify storefronts.

- Customize Shopify themes and Liquid templates to match brand identity.

- Integrate third-party apps, APIs, and payment gateways.

- Optimize website performance, speed, and SEO.

- Collaborate with marketing and product teams to enhance user experience and conversion rates.

- Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues promptly.



Requirements:

- Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience with Shopify development.

- Strong expertise in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+), Liquid, and JSON.

- Experience with Shopify Plus, custom app development, and REST or GraphQL APIs.

- Knowledge of UX/UI principles and mobile-first design.

- Familiarity with Google Analytics, Shopify Analytics, and conversion tracking.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Preferred Skills (Bonus):

What We Offer:

- Exciting projects with recognized brands.

- A collaborative and creative environment.

- Opportunity for growth within a dynamic eCommerce-focused company.



Looking forward to connecting with talented professionals who can help us bring our eCommerce vision to life.

title: Soil Moisture Tester
description:
We run a premium beauty + skincare education brand. We sell digital products, courses, and mentorship. Our funnels matter. Our design matters. And our KPIs matter.



We’re looking for someone who can build funnels inside GoHighLevel that look modern, feel premium, and convert.

This is not a “copy/paste templates” role. We want someone who can look at a page and immediately see what’s wrong — and fix it.



What You’ll Do 

1) Build + Improve Funnels in GoHighLevel

* Build landing pages, opt-in pages, checkout pages, upsell pages, and thank-you pages

* Improve older funnels (design refresh + conversion upgrades)

* Make funnels mobile-first and fast-loading

* Ensure everything is clean, consistent, and on-brand



2) Design That Actually Converts

* Create scroll-stopping layouts with strong hierarchy (headline ? proof ? CTA)

* Improve spacing, typography, contrast, and structure

* Add visual elements that make offers feel premium (not “cheap internet marketing”)

* Design clean section graphics, icons, product mockups, and banners when needed



3) Funnel Quality Control (Non-Negotiable)

* Test every step: forms, calendars, automations, links, checkouts, tracking

* Make sure tags, fields, and pipeline stages work correctly

* Catch errors before they cost us sales





What We’re Looking For (Must-Haves)

You are a fit if you:

* Have real GoHighLevel funnel building experience (not just “basic familiarity”)

* Have strong graphic design taste (spacing, typography, modern layout)

* Understand conversion principles (clarity, CTA placement, offer framing, friction removal)

* Work fast without rushing or breaking things

* Communicate clearly and give proactive updates

* Are extremely honest and consistent with time tracking





Tools You Should Know

* GoHighLevel (funnels, forms, calendars, workflows)

* Canva or Adobe (Photoshop/Illustrator preferred but not required)

* Google Drive (organized files)

* Loom (quick updates)



Bonus (not required, but a plus):

* Basic HTML/CSS

* Meta Pixel / Google Analytics setup familiarity

* A/B test mindset



Working Style

* You’ll get tasks, references, and assets — but you’re expected to think

* If something looks weak, you’ll suggest improvements

* If something breaks, you’ll fix it

* If you notice a better way, you’ll bring it up





Pay + Schedule

* Starting rate: $6–$12/hr depending on skill and portfolio

* Hours: Part-time to start (10–25 hrs/week) with the option to grow

* Bonuses: available for high-performing funnel improvements and fast turnaround work

* Time Tracking: required (Clockify or similar)



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)

To apply, start your message with: “FUNNEL”

Then include:

Your GoHighLevel funnel portfolio (links/screenshots)

1–2 examples of a funnel you improved 

Your hourly rate + weekly availability



A short answer to this:

If you had to improve conversions on a landing page in 30 minutes, what are the first 5 things you check?
